en-GB: My name is Maddy Greenisle. I work for the Tower of Knowledge.

en: I'm just a junior aide in the Council…
en-GB: I'm just a junior aide in the Council…

en: …but if you ever need to contact my superiors without going through official channels…
en-GB: …but if you ever need to contact my superiors without going through official channels…

en: …just see me at the Tower, downtown.
en-GB: …just see me at the Tower, downtown.

en: Why the sudden interest in us?
en-GB: Why the sudden interest in us?

en: You proved yourselves in the Badlands…
en-GB: You proved yourselves in the Badlands…

en: …and we in the Tower of Knowledge value skilled adventurers.
en-GB: …and we in the Tower of Knowledge value skilled adventurers.

en: If you find anything of historical value, we'll pay well…
en-GB: If you find anything of historical value, we'll pay well…

en: And if things go well, we might share some of our own secrets.
en-GB: And if things go well, we might share some of our own secrets.

en: All right - we'll think about it.
en-GB: All right - we'll think about it.

en: I am Halman Summer of the Guild of Antiquarians.
en-GB: I am Halman Summer of the Guild of Antiquarians.

en: I am instructed to invite you to visit us at the Embassy of the Snow Alliance.
en-GB: I am instructed to invite you to visit us at the Embassy of the Snow Alliance.

en: You're based at an embassy? I thought the Council was neutral.
en-GB: You're based at an embassy? I thought the Council was neutral.

en: We don't have a house of our own in Caer Cyflen - unlike the Tower of Knowledge…
en-GB: We don't have a house of our own in Caer Cyflen - unlike the Tower of Knowledge…

en: Anyway, we'd be interested in any antiquities you might bring back.
en-GB: Anyway, we'd be interested in any antiquities you might bring back.

en: We pay very well, even for things you might think are worthless.
en-GB: We pay very well, even for things you might think are worthless.

en: The Scavengers? They'd sell an antique Emperor's sword for its metal value.
en-GB: The Scavengers? They'd sell an antique Emperor's sword for its metal value.

en: But we can offer more than gold.
en-GB: But we can offer more than gold.

en: Antique magical items, for instance. You'll never find their like elsewhere.
en-GB: Antique magical items, for instance. You'll never find their like elsewhere.

en: Good to know. Thanks for the invitation.
en-GB: Good to know. Thanks for the invitation.

en: Can I ask for a minute of your time, deputies?
en-GB: Can I ask for a minute of your time, deputies?

en: We're in kind of a hurry.
en-GB: We're in kind of a hurry.

en: I know. I won't delay you long.
en-GB: I know. I won't delay you long.

en: My name is Heddlon Surespell. I represent the Arcaneum.
en-GB: My name is Heddlon Surespell. I represent the Arcaneum.

en: And the Arcaneum belongs to the New Empire. Do you really want to be seen talking to us?
en-GB: And the Arcaneum belongs to the New Empire. Do you really want to be seen talking to us?

en: My business is magic, not politics. And no, I have no quarrel with you.
en-GB: My business is magic, not politics. And no, I have no quarrel with you.

en: You may not see us Imperials as friends, but we take the Council very seriously.
en-GB: You may not see us Imperials as friends, but we take the Council very seriously.

en: We are particularly interested in anything from the Old Empire that you might find in the Badlands.
en-GB: We are particularly interested in anything from the Old Empire that you might find in the Badlands.

en: Anything from the Manacalon-era Arcaneum, even more so.
en-GB: Anything from the Manacalon-era Arcaneum, even more so.

en: Of course we'd pay you handsomely for this Crown, but I know that is not possible.
en-GB: Of course we'd pay you handsomely for this Crown, but I know that is not possible.

en: Anyway, we have an unrivaled trove of magical and other knowledge.
en-GB: Anyway, we have an unrivalled trove of magical and other knowledge.

en: Think it over. You can find me at the Gravekeep's Cask.
en-GB: Think it over. You can find me at the Gravekeep's Cask.

en: What can I say? I love Martel's beer. Even though it tastes like donkey piss…
en-GB: What can I say? I love Martel's beer. Even though it tastes like donkey piss…

en: That was our joke, the first day we met. Was he spying on us?
en-GB: That was our joke, the first day we met. Was he spying on us?

en: Maybe he just agrees about the taste.
en-GB: Maybe he just agrees about the taste.

en: Would you have a moment, deputies?
en-GB: Would you have a moment, deputies?

en: All right, but make it quick.
en-GB: All right, but make it quick.

en: I am Joriel Foxeye, from the Circle of Danantar.
en-GB: I am Joriel Foxeye, from the Circle of Danantar.

en: The same magic school where the Princess studies?
en-GB: The same magic school where the Princess studies?

en: Is she a good student? A powerful wizard?
en-GB: Is she a good student? A powerful wizard?

en: That's not for me to say - and you seemed to be in a rush?
en-GB: That's not for me to say - and you seemed to be in a rush?

en: I just want you to know that our grand master Edvan Danantar has noticed you.
en-GB: I just want you to know that our grand master Edvan Danantar has noticed you.

en: He talked a lot, for sure.
en-GB: He talked a lot, for sure.

en: He's a man of great authority.
en-GB: He's a man of great authority.

en: He'd like you to know that our doors are open to you if you'd care to visit us.
en-GB: He'd like you to know that our doors are open to you if you'd care to visit us.

en: You can find me at Sunblaze Court.
en-GB: You can find me at Sunblaze Court.

en: Interested in Badlands treasures, I suppose, like everyone else?
en-GB: Interested in Badlands treasures, I suppose, like everyone else?

en: Well, if you ever come across old spellbooks or spell scrolls, we'd love to see them.
en-GB: Well, if you ever come across old spellbooks or spell scrolls, we'd love to see them.

en: In return, we have the largest collection of spells and potion recipes you could ever hope to see.
en-GB: In return, we have the largest collection of spells and potion recipes you could ever hope to see.

en: Now, if you were to prefer feeding the New Empire's wizards with more magical knowledge than the Principality…
en-GB: Now, if you were to prefer feeding the New Empire's wizards with more magical knowledge than the Principality…

en: …that would be troubling to many on the Council.
en-GB: …that would be troubling to many on the Council.

en: Neutrality means we don't treat you any differently than we treat them.
en-GB: Neutrality means we don't treat you any differently than we treat them.

en: Of course. Neutrality is the rule.
en-GB: Of course. Neutrality is the rule.

en: Ah - our crownbearer is up again!
en-GB: Ah - our crownbearer is up again!

en: Honorable Council Members! Please take your seats!
en-GB: honourable Council Members! Please take your seats!

en: I have confirmed that our deputy is indeed magically attuned to the Crown.
en-GB: I have confirmed that our deputy is indeed magically attuned to the Crown.

en: It is… an uncommonly powerful attunement, unlike anything I've seen.
en-GB: It is… an uncommonly powerful attunement, unlike anything I've seen.

en: I strongly recommend against forcing a separation.
en-GB: I strongly recommend against forcing a separation.

en: With the Council's permission, I'd like to try a little experiment.
en-GB: With the Council's permission, I'd like to try a little experiment.

en: I have here the gem that Captain Merran recovered recently.
en-GB: I have here the gem that Captain Merran recovered recently.

en: I have reason to believe that it might be…
en-GB: I have reason to believe that it might be…

en: As I suspected! It belongs to the Crown!
en-GB: As I suspected! It belongs to the Crown!

en: Commander! Take Her Royal Highness to safety!
en-GB: Commander! Take Her Royal Highness to safety!

en: Are you going to faint again?
en-GB: Are you going to faint again?

en: I just had a… vision, I guess it was.
en-GB: I just had a… vision, I guess it was.

en: I must… find the other gems.
en-GB: I must… find the other gems.

en: The Crown wants the other gems back.
en-GB: The Crown wants the other gems back.

en: I was fighting Soraks - but I wasn't myself.
en-GB: I was fighting Soraks - but I wasn't myself.

en: Honorable delegates, I suggest we focus on the Soraks for now.
en-GB: honourable delegates, I suggest we focus on the Soraks for now.

en: What about this artifact? The other gems?
en-GB: What about this artefact? The other gems?

en: I think I can find them. I can… feel them.
en-GB: I think I can find them. I can… feel them.

en: This is old Manacalon magic. Anything is possible.
en-GB: This is old Manacalon magic. Anything is possible.

en: Let the crownbearer and the other deputies follow that quest.
en-GB: Let the crownbearer and the other deputies follow that quest.

en: Find the other gems if you can, but keep us informed.
en-GB: Find the other gems if you can, but keep us informed.

en: In the meantime, we will formulate a response to the Soraks.
en-GB: In the meantime, we will formulate a response to the Soraks.

en: Let's vote. Delegates - do you agree?
en-GB: Let's vote. Delegates - do you agree?

en: Oh? pardon me. Yes, I concur…
en-GB: Oh? pardon me. Yes, I concur…

en: I mean, aye. They should go and find the diamonds - the gems.
en-GB: I mean, aye. They should go and find the diamonds - the gems.

en: So resolved! Let it be recorded!
en-GB: So resolved! Let it be recorded!

en: Thank you, honored delegates. The Council is now in recess.
en-GB: Thank you, honoured delegates. The Council is now in recess.

en: What do you mean the Crown wants its missing gems?
en-GB: What do you mean the Crown wants its missing gems?

en: I… I can't explain. I just feel it. Anyway, we have a new mission.
en-GB: I… I can't explain. I just feel it. Anyway, we have a new mission.

en: All right, then. So where are we going, crownbearer?
en-GB: All right, then. So where are we going, crownbearer?

en: Look who's here! The Sorak hunters themselves!
en-GB: Look who's here! The Sorak hunters themselves!

en: First Scavenger? Where does that come from?
en-GB: First Scavenger? Where does that come from?

en: Short version: When we started crossing the Marches to the Badlands, I was one of the first.
en-GB: Short version: When we started crossing the Marches to the Badlands, I was one of the first.

en: Now, I'm just the ugliest one still standing.
en-GB: Now, I'm just the ugliest one still standing.

en: What should we know about the Badlands? Any advice?
en-GB: What should we know about the Badlands? Any advice?

en: Bring a good cleric with good healing spells. You'll need them.
en-GB: Bring a good cleric with good healing spells. You'll need them.

en: You're a legend. Why do you seem so sour?
en-GB: You're a legend. Why do you seem so sour?

en: Sour? It's this ale that's sour, that's all.
en-GB: Sour? It's this ale that's sour, that's all.

en: The high and mighty Council, paying clueless kids like you to go and get killed in the Badlands.
en-GB: The high and mighty Council, paying clueless kids like you to go and get killed in the Badlands.

en: But they're not asking good old Arwin - nooo. Go figure.
en-GB: But they're not asking good old Arwin - nooo. Go figure.

en: It's because I got them figured out.
en-GB: It's because I got them figured out.

en: This Legacy Council is full of it.
en-GB: This Legacy Council is full of it.

en: Acting all united and lovey-dovey while they plot to rob each other.
en-GB: Acting all united and lovey-dovey while they plot to rob each other.

en: Wouldn't surprise me if some of them were even Soraks in disguise. You know they can shapeshift.
en-GB: Wouldn't surprise me if some of them were even Soraks in disguise. You know they can shapeshift.

en: Hey, I was right about them hiding in the Badlands, wasn't I?
en-GB: Hey, I was right about them hiding in the Badlands, wasn't I?

en: Honorable members of the Council, please be seated!
en-GB: honourable members of the Council, please be seated!

en: The Legacy Council is now in session!
en-GB: The Legacy Council is now in session!

en: Honorable members of the Council, we at the Arcaneum…
en-GB: honourable members of the Council, we at the Arcaneum…

en: …have gathered crucial information about this Crown.
en-GB: …have gathered crucial information about this Crown.

en: This is indeed the Crown of the Magister, belonging to Kaseinax, Eternal Soul of the Eight Traditions…
en-GB: This is indeed the Crown of the Magister, belonging to Kaseinax, Eternal Soul of the Eight Traditions…

en: …ninth and last Magister of the Manacalon Arcaneum.
en-GB: …ninth and last Magister of the Manacalon Arcaneum.

en: At the time, there were eight masters of magic, one for each of the old schools.
en-GB: At the time, there were eight masters of magic, one for each of the old schools.

en: In time of need, each the masters lent their gem to the Magister, the head of the Arcaneum.
en-GB: In time of need, each the masters lent their gem to the Magister, the head of the Arcaneum.

en: Placed in the Crown, they granted additional powers…
en-GB: Placed in the Crown, they granted additional powers…

en: …that enabled the Magister to cast spells or perform rituals of incredible power.
en-GB: …that enabled the Magister to cast spells or perform rituals of incredible power.

en: Such as the closing of the Rift from Tirmar.
en-GB: Such as the closing of the Rift from Tirmar.

en: Now… there is some debate about…
en-GB: Now… there is some debate about…

en: …whether the Crown, with all its gems…
en-GB: …whether the Crown, with all its gems…

en: Nonsense! The Rift has been closed for a millennium!
en-GB: Nonsense! The Rift has been closed for a millennium!

en: Solasta paid a high enough price for that!
en-GB: Solasta paid a high enough price for that!

en: Have you been to the Badlands recently?
en-GB: Have you been to the Badlands recently?

en: For our part, now that the existence of Sorr-Akkath on Solasta has been confirmed…
en-GB: For our part, now that the existence of Sorr-Akkath on Solasta has been confirmed…

en: …we have gathered proof that they are operating everywhere in the Eastern Kingdoms.
en-GB: …we have gathered proof that they are operating everywhere in the Eastern Kingdoms.

en: Including here, in the Principality of Masgarth.
en-GB: Including here, in the Principality of Masgarth.

en: The Soraks are looking for the Crown and its gems. That cannot be a coincidence.
en-GB: The Soraks are looking for the Crown and its gems. That cannot be a coincidence.

en: A powerful artifact, certainly - but reopening the Rift?
en-GB: A powerful artefact, certainly - but reopening the Rift?

en: It took all the gods of Tirmar to open it!
en-GB: It took all the gods of Tirmar to open it!

en: No one knows for sure what the Crown can do.
en-GB: No one knows for sure what the Crown can do.

en: As you know, it protects itself from our divination spells…
en-GB: As you know, it protects itself from our divination spells…

en: …that is one of its mysterious powers.
en-GB: …that is one of its mysterious powers.

en: Then why would the Soraks think they know better?
en-GB: Then why would the Soraks think they know better?

en: Their people, their culture - they must have been obsessing about this for a thousand years!
en-GB: Their people, their culture - they must have been obsessing about this for a thousand years!

en: While we spent that time fighting each other, they had to stick together and hide to survive.
en-GB: While we spent that time fighting each other, they had to stick together and hide to survive.

en: But can we take the risk?
en-GB: But can we take the risk?

en: The Crown belongs to those who found it. Those are the rules.
en-GB: The Crown belongs to those who found it. Those are the rules.

en: The quest for the gems should be completed.
en-GB: The quest for the gems should be completed.

en: Only this way can we learn more about the Crown and its powers.
en-GB: Only this way can we learn more about the Crown and its powers.

en: These deputies - well, they're not strong enough! No offense.
en-GB: These deputies - well, they're not strong enough! No offence.

en: Tell that to the Crown. And they've done well enough so far, wouldn't you say?
en-GB: Tell that to the Crown. And they've done well enough so far, wouldn't you say?

en: Maybe the deputies would like to speak.
en-GB: Maybe the deputies would like to speak.

en: After all, they are members of the Council now, aren't they?
en-GB: After all, they are members of the Council now, aren't they?

en: We feel perfectly able to continue searching for the gems.
en-GB: We feel perfectly able to continue searching for the gems.

en: With all due respect, we are confident that we can fulfill this quest ourselves.
en-GB: With all due respect, we are confident that we can fulfill this quest ourselves.

en: We got this. Really, it's under control.
en-GB: We got this. Really, it's under control.

en: You can give us the means to be stronger. Weapons, armor, maybe some spells?
en-GB: You can give us the means to be stronger. Weapons, armour, maybe some spells?

en: May we be so bold as to ask your for material support? Weapons, armor, or spells, for instance?
en-GB: May we be so bold as to ask your for material support? Weapons, armour, or spells, for instance?

en: We'd be stronger if you tossed a few things our way. You know - weapons, armor, spells - that sort of thing.
en-GB: We'd be stronger if you tossed a few things our way. You know - weapons, armour, spells - that sort of thing.

en: You may trust that we are devoted to this quest. We are well aware of its importance.
en-GB: You may trust that we are devoted to this quest. We are well aware of its importance.

en: We are fully devoted to the quest, and perfectly aware of its vital importance.
en-GB: We are fully devoted to the quest, and perfectly aware of its vital importance.

en: We get it - this is big. We won't let you down!
en-GB: We get it - this is big. We won't let you down!

en: We didn't change our mind about the Crown - it's ours!
en-GB: We didn't change our mind about the Crown - it's ours!

en: We must reiterate that we have no intention of giving up the Crown.
en-GB: We must reiterate that we have no intention of giving up the Crown.

en: Let's be clear. The Crown is ours, and it stays ours.
en-GB: Let's be clear. The Crown is ours, and it stays ours.

en: Five more gems to find. Do you even have a lead?
en-GB: Five more gems to find. Do you even have a lead?

en: Yes - the best lead possible. The Crown itself tells us where to go.
en-GB: Yes - the best lead possible. The Crown itself tells us where to go.

en: The Soraks will come after you - you know that?
en-GB: The Soraks will come after you - you know that?

en: But you have our complete support in this struggle.
en-GB: But you have our complete support in this struggle.

en: That's right! We can't risk the Soraks overpowering them and taking the Crown!
en-GB: That's right! We can't risk the Soraks overpowering them and taking the Crown!

en: Well, you're welcome to provide them with whatever weapons and armors you like, Marshal.
en-GB: Well, you're welcome to provide them with whatever weapons and armours you like, Marshal.

en: We're just trying to increase our chance of success.
en-GB: We're just trying to increase our chance of success.

en: We might have a few spells that can increase your chance of… survival.
en-GB: We might have a few spells that can increase your chance of… survival.

en: Trust is a hot topic, these days.
en-GB: Trust is a hot topic, these days.

en: Nobody here questions your dedication. You've done a lot already.
en-GB: Nobody here questions your dedication. You've done a lot already.

en: Yet, we should support you in your efforts.
en-GB: Yet, we should support you in your efforts.

en: You understand, though - it is your responsibility to keep the Crown out of the wrong hands?
en-GB: You understand, though - it is your responsibility to keep the Crown out of the wrong hands?

en: The Crown chose us. I doubt it would do any good to anyone else.
en-GB: The Crown chose us. I doubt it would do any good to anyone else.

en: Oh, so you're experts in Manacalon sorcery now?
en-GB: Oh, so you're experts in Manacalon sorcery now?

en: I can only concur. You have a responsibility, and it's more important than ownership.
en-GB: I can only concur. You have a responsibility, and it's more important than ownership.

en: If that is all, may we conclude?
en-GB: If that is all, may we conclude?

en: I'd like to say a word, if that is appropriate.
en-GB: I'd like to say a word, if that is appropriate.

en: Of course, Your Highness. We are listening.
en-GB: Of course, Your Highness. We are listening.

en: I think our brave deputies shouldn't be, you know, sleeping in a… city inn.
en-GB: I think our brave deputies shouldn't be, you know, sleeping in a… city inn.

en: We have a very comfortable residence near the Palace.
en-GB: We have a very comfortable residence near the Palace.

en: They would be safer there, don't you think?
en-GB: They would be safer there, don't you think?

en: That would be my - I mean, our - part in supporting the quest.
en-GB: That would be my - I mean, our - part in supporting the quest.

en: I must remind you that your decisions as head of state are not subject to Council approval.
en-GB: I must remind you that your decisions as head of state are not subject to Council approval.

en: Might I suggest that you reiterate your offer outside these walls?
en-GB: Might I suggest that you reiterate your offer outside these walls?

en: Of course. I beg the Council's pardon.
en-GB: Of course. I beg the Council's pardon.

en: Then I think that is all?
en-GB: Then I think that is all?

en: Thank you. The Legacy Council is now in recess.
en-GB: Thank you. The Legacy Council is now in recess.

en: Her Royal Highness asked me to reiterate her offer to accommodate you at the Palace Residence.
en-GB: Her Royal Highness asked me to reiterate her offer to accommodate you at the Palace Residence.

en: I'm not sure what that is.
en-GB: I'm not sure what that is.

en: A house for plenipotentiaries, emissaries, and other guests of the Court.
en-GB: A house for plenipotentiaries, emissaries, and other guests of the Court.

en: In the Palace. Ask for Ravensworth, the royal butler. He'll show you.
en-GB: In the Palace. Ask for Ravensworth, the royal butler. He'll show you.

en: I am to give this to any senior deputy of the Council.
en-GB: I am to give this to any senior deputy of the Council.

en: A command word, to teleport your party to the city's Imperial Gate.
en-GB: A command word, to teleport your party to the city's Imperial Gate.

en: We can't do that, I'm pretty sure.
en-GB: We can't do that, I'm pretty sure.

en: Well, word is that in the Badlands…
en-GB: Well, word is that in the Badlands…

en: …you may come across functioning Major Gates.
en-GB: …you may come across functioning Major Gates.

en: If you do, use this command word and you'll be brought back here.
en-GB: If you do, use this command word and you'll be brought back here.

en: Take note of any command word on the Gate you find…
en-GB: Take note of any command word on the Gate you find…

en: …and you'll be able to return there the same way.
en-GB: …and you'll be able to return there the same way.

en: So far, no one's found any.
en-GB: So far, no one's found any.

en: Stay in the light, senior deputies.
en-GB: Stay in the light, senior deputies.

en: One of the faithful, I see. Nice to meet you!
en-GB: One of the faithful, I see. Nice to meet you!

en: You may come here at any time to seek the help of the Church.
en-GB: You may come here at any time to seek the help of the Church.

en: That is good to know, Chaplain!
en-GB: That is good to know, Chaplain!

en: I represent the Church of Einar, the god of valor and fidelity.
en-GB: I represent the Church of Einar, the god of valor and fidelity.

en: We provide various services for those who need them.
en-GB: We provide various services for those who need them.

en: Those who seek his healing are rarely poor.
en-GB: Those who seek his healing are rarely poor.

en: Thank you - we need to go.
en-GB: Thank you - we need to go.

en: Do you have anything for the Circle?
en-GB: Do you have anything for the Circle?

en: Not really. Just stopped by to say hello.
en-GB: Not really. Just stopped by to say hello.

en: You have some treasure in your backpacks?
en-GB: You have some treasure in your backpacks?

en: See what you think of this.
en-GB: See what you think of this.

en: Just passing by to say hello.
en-GB: Just passing by to say hello.

en: Ah, well. It was good to see you.
en-GB: Ah, well. It was good to see you.

en: Do you have some lovely loot from the Badlands?
en-GB: Do you have some lovely loot from the Badlands?

en: Just missed your smiling face, Miss Greenisle!
en-GB: Just missed your smiling face, Miss Greenisle!

en: Such nice manners! All too rare, these days.
en-GB: Such nice manners! All too rare, these days.

en: The Legacy Council is now in session!
en-GB: The Legacy Council is now in session!

en: Ah - senior deputies! What news is there?
en-GB: Ah - senior deputies! What news is there?

en: My lord, I'm afraid the situation is less than ideal.
en-GB: My lord, I'm afraid the situation is less than ideal.

en: It's not good news, my Lord.
en-GB: It's not good news, my Lord.

en: We have six gems, but we can't seem to find the others.
en-GB: We have six gems, but we can't seem to find the others.

en: We tested the first one - it can't be done!
en-GB: We tested the first one - it can't be done!

en: So the Crown must remain incomplete?
en-GB: So the Crown must remain incomplete?

en: Maybe the Soraks have the missing gems.
en-GB: Maybe the Soraks have the missing gems.

en: After all, they attacked you more than once. They're clearly still after the Crown.
en-GB: After all, they attacked you more than once. They're clearly still after the Crown.

en: If you can't find the gems, why keep the Crown out there?
en-GB: If you can't find the gems, why keep the Crown out there?

en: It will keep attracting the Soraks.
en-GB: It will keep attracting the Soraks.

en: I'm sorry, senior deputies, but despite the attunement...
en-GB: I'm sorry, senior deputies, but despite the attunement...

en: ...I believe the Crown should be secured...
en-GB: ...I believe the Crown should be secured...

en: ...and secured by more than four adventurers who spend their nights camped in the Badlands!
en-GB: ...and secured by more than four adventurers who spend their nights camped in the Badlands!

en: We can't do that to them! They have served the Council faithfully!
en-GB: We can't do that to them! They have served the Council faithfully!

en: Don't be naive! We are facing a major threat!
en-GB: Don't be naive! We are facing a major threat!

en: You understand the meaning of sacrifice, and so should they!
en-GB: You understand the meaning of sacrifice, and so should they!

en: We have searched the Badlands for these gems, at our own risk.
en-GB: We have searched the Badlands for these gems, at our own risk.

en: We trusted you to keep your word and leave us the Crown.
en-GB: We trusted you to keep your word and leave us the Crown.

en: If I may, I think we need more time to consider the situation.
en-GB: If I may, I think we need more time to consider the situation.

en: I could use the day to consult with my people.
en-GB: I could use the day to consult with my people.

en: The Legacy Council is now ajdourned!
en-GB: The Legacy Council is now ajdourned!

en: I have a bad feeling about this.
en-GB: I have a bad feeling about this.

en: I knew it! They'll take the Crown, and never mind what that does to me!
en-GB: I knew it! They'll take the Crown, and never mind what that does to me!

en: Typical! Sat there on their pretty chairs...doesn't matter if I die!
en-GB: Typical! Sat there on their pretty chairs...doesn't matter if I die!

en: What's the point? We know what's at stake.
en-GB: What's the point? We know what's at stake.

en: The Soraks will keep coming after us. After the Crown.
en-GB: The Soraks will keep coming after us. After the Crown.

en: We could retrace our steps - go back to where we found the gems. Perhaps there's a trail we overlooked.
en-GB: We could retrace our steps - go back to where we found the gems. Perhaps there's a trail we overlooked.

en: There's nothing anymore - I can't feel another gem anywhere!
en-GB: There's nothing anymore - I can't feel another gem anywhere!

en: I would advise you to avoid the Palace Residence tonight.
en-GB: I would advise you to avoid the Palace Residence tonight.

en: I'm not at liberty to say...just trust me.
en-GB: I'm not at liberty to say...just trust me.

en: You have your lodgings at the Gravekeep's Cask. You should spend the night there.
en-GB: You have your lodgings at the Gravekeep's Cask. You should spend the night there.

en: What kind of advice is that?
en-GB: What kind of advice is that?

en: You must realize your suggestion is...unusual. Suspicious, even.
en-GB: You must realise your suggestion is...unusual. Suspicious, even.

en: Are you crazy? Or are you up to something?
en-GB: Are you crazy? Or are you up to something?

en: Are you really working for the Arcaneum?
en-GB: Are you really working for the Arcaneum?

en: Why else would I be here?
en-GB: Why else would I be here?

en: I have no idea what to do, but I'd like to sleep in a bed tonight.
en-GB: I have no idea what to do, but I'd like to sleep in a bed tonight.

en: I like Captain Ironshell kissing me goodnight.
en-GB: I like Captain Ironshell kissing me goodnight.

en: Soraks! Right here in our damn room!
en-GB: Soraks! Right here in our damn room!

en: The Sorr-Akkath in the palace residence!
en-GB: The Sorr-Akkath in the palace residence!

en: Why would he know what the Soraks would do?
en-GB: Why would he know what the Soraks would do?

en: He tried to warn us. Not what an enemy would do.
en-GB: He tried to warn us. Not what an enemy would do.

en: He tried to save our hides, remember?
en-GB: He tried to save our hides, remember?

en: His warning might have saved us all, mind you.
en-GB: His warning might have saved us all, mind you.

en: He just wants us to think he's a friend.
en-GB: He just wants us to think he's a friend.

en: It might be an elaborate scheme to gain our trust.
en-GB: It might be an elaborate scheme to gain our trust.

en: Be that as it may, what shall we do now?
en-GB: Be that as it may, what shall we do now?

en: Back to the Council, I suppose, and see what they decided.
en-GB: Back to the Council, I suppose, and see what they decided.

en: We will return to the Council and hear what they have to say.
en-GB: We will return to the Council and hear what they have to say.

en: Or we could pay Surespell a visit.
en-GB: Or we could pay Surespell a visit.

en: Do you find our visit surprising, Master Surespell?
en-GB: Do you find our visit surprising, Master Surespell?

en: Not really. I did warn you, after all. I'm glad you were careful.
en-GB: Not really. I did warn you, after all. I'm glad you were careful.

en: A great, steaming pile of hunch. Got a bridge to sell, too?
en-GB: A great, steaming pile of hunch. Got a bridge to sell, too?

en: You can't expect us to believe that?
en-GB: You can't expect us to believe that?

en: Oh, I have friends who...gather information.
en-GB: Oh, I have friends who...gather information.

en: The threat felt credible. I thought it wise to share.
en-GB: The threat felt credible. I thought it wise to share.

en: It felt real enough to us, too.
en-GB: It felt real enough to us, too.

en: Real enough to leave a scar, that much is certain.
en-GB: Real enough to leave a scar, that much is certain.

en: You know more than you're telling.
en-GB: You know more than you're telling.

en: Always. But I'm on your side, and that's all that matters.
en-GB: Always. But I'm on your side, and that's all that matters.

en: Really? Aren't we lucky? So what other pearls of wisdom do you have to share - friend?
en-GB: Really? Aren't we lucky? So what other pearls of wisdom do you have to share - friend?

en: In that case, you'd be happy to advise us further, I presume?
en-GB: In that case, you'd be happy to advise us further, I presume?

en: Certainly. Always drink wine at the Gravekeep's Cask. Their beer is utterly foul.
en-GB: Certainly. Always drink wine at the Gravekeep's Cask. Their beer is utterly foul.

en: That's disappointing. You can do better than common knowledge, I'm sure.
en-GB: That's disappointing. You can do better than common knowledge, I'm sure.

en: But clearly you're here for business, not small talk.
en-GB: But clearly you're here for business, not small talk.

en: Do you find our visit surprising, Master Surespell?
en-GB: Do you find our visit surprising, Master Surespell?

en: Not at all, since you followed my...advice.
en-GB: Not at all, since you followed my...advice.

en: I heard there was some disturbance at the residence.
en-GB: I heard there was some disturbance at the residence.

en: Your quarters at the residence were ransacked!
en-GB: Your quarters at the residence were ransacked!

en: During the night. It's lucky you weren't there.
en-GB: During the night. It's lucky you weren't there.

en: Eh. We could have handled a burglar or two.
en-GB: Eh. We could have handled a burglar or two.

en: No doubt we would have seen the villains off, had we been there.
en-GB: No doubt we would have seen the villains off, had we been there.

en: They were more than simple burglars, to infiltrate the palace undetected.
en-GB: They were more than simple burglars, to infiltrate the palace undetected.

en: I can't say for sure but...
en-GB: I can't say for sure but...

en: So much for palace security, then. Thanks a lot!
en-GB: So much for palace security, then. Thanks a lot!

en: We were supposed to be safe there, remember?
en-GB: We were supposed to be safe there, remember?

en: I'm well aware. We have put further magical security measures in place.
en-GB: I'm well aware. We have put further magical security measures in place.

en: Thank you for keeping us informed, captain.
en-GB: Thank you for keeping us informed, captain.

en: Good day to you, senior deputies.
en-GB: Good day to you, senior deputies.

en: So he told the truth, that Heddlon.
en-GB: So he told the truth, that Heddlon.

en: It appears, Heddlon Surespell was right.
en-GB: It appears, Heddlon Surespell was right.

en: He's a spy, or something similar.
en-GB: He's a spy, or something similar.

en: I'm pretty sure he's Imperial Intelligence.
en-GB: I'm pretty sure he's Imperial Intelligence.

en: The guy is a spook, it's practically written on his face.
en-GB: The guy is a spook, it's practically written on his face.

en: We must decide on our next move.
en-GB: We must decide on our next move.

en: Back to the Council, I suppose, and see what they decided.
en-GB: Back to the Council, I suppose, and see what they decided.

en: We will return to the Council and hear what they have to say.
en-GB: We will return to the Council and hear what they have to say.

en: Or we could pay Surespell a visit.
en-GB: Or we could pay Surespell a visit.

en: The Legacy Council is now in session!
en-GB: The Legacy Council is now in session!

en: Honourable Council members, we've seen Soraks in the palace - and their god Sorr-Tarr has other followers, too.
en-GB: Honourable Council members, we've seen Soraks in the palace - and their god Sorr-Tarr has other followers, too.

en: It's clear the Crown is not safe. The Antiquarians' Guild moves that the Crown be taken to a place of safety.
en-GB: It's clear the Crown is not safe. The Antiquarians' Guild moves that the Crown be taken to a place of safety.

en: While the deputies search for the remaining gems…
en-GB: While the deputies search for the remaining gems…

en: ..the Council will study the Crown and decide how it may best be used.
en-GB: ..the Council will study the Crown and decide how it may best be used.

en: The Guild proposes that the Council vote on this matter immediately.
en-GB: The Guild proposes that the Council vote on this matter immediately.

en: You will wait for your turn to speak, senior deputy!
en-GB: You will wait for your turn to speak, senior deputy!

en: We searched the Badlands for these gems, and now you're just taking the Crown away from us?
en-GB: We searched the Badlands for these gems, and now you're just taking the Crown away from us?

en: We are all well aware of your reservations, and we understand them.
en-GB: We are all well aware of your reservations, and we understand them.

en: Yet, from what I heard, all parties have agreed that you should comply...
en-GB: Yet, from what I heard, all parties have agreed that you should comply...

en: What security? Just last night, Soraks attacked our quarters in the residence!
en-GB: What security? Just last night, Soraks attacked our quarters in the residence!

en: Well, find the damned Soraks, then!
en-GB: Well, find the damned Soraks, then!

en: Where are your wizards and their divination spells?
en-GB: Where are your wizards and their divination spells?

en: Lord Sunblaze, you're supposed to be neutral, here!
en-GB: Lord Sunblaze, you're supposed to be neutral, here!

en: Someone must introduce a formal request.
en-GB: Someone must introduce a formal request.

en: You're right, let's vote. Only senior members, please.
en-GB: You're right, let's vote. Only senior members, please.

en: Those for securing the Crown, say aye.
en-GB: Those for securing the Crown, say aye.

en: Well help you with the...attunement issue.
en-GB: Well help you with the...attunement issue.

en: Wait! Who's going to take the Crown, and where?
en-GB: Wait! Who's going to take the Crown, and where?

en: Well, the most secure location would be...
en-GB: Well, the most secure location would be...

en: ...the temple of Einar, of course. The Hearth.
en-GB: ...the temple of Einar, of course. The Hearth.

en: Of course - right here in Caer Cyflen!
en-GB: Of course - right here in Caer Cyflen!

en: Neutral ground, of course, but still the Principality of Masgarth is the center of Solasta!
en-GB: Neutral ground, of course, but still the Principality of Masgarth is the centre of Solasta!

en: Do you have a better idea, Dean Faisech?
en-GB: Do you have a better idea, Dean Faisech?

en: How many high-ranking paladins in your Tower, Faisech?
en-GB: How many high-ranking paladins in your Tower, Faisech?

en: More than actual wizards in your school!
en-GB: More than actual wizards in your school!

en: Remember the dignity of your positions, my lords!
en-GB: Remember the dignity of your positions, my lords!

en: Senior deputies - if you please? The Council has spoken.
en-GB: Senior deputies - if you please? The Council has spoken.

en: This is a mistake. We are bound to the Crown.
en-GB: This is a mistake. We are bound to the Crown.

en: You are sworn deputies. You must comply.
en-GB: You are sworn deputies. You must comply.

en: The Council doesn't deserve the Crown - you just proved that!
en-GB: The Council doesn't deserve the Crown - you just proved that!

en: Surrender the Crown, as the Council orders.
en-GB: Surrender the Crown, as the Council orders.

en: And you shall be commended, senior deputies.
en-GB: And you shall be commended, senior deputies.

en: You keep bickering instead of looking for the traitor among you!
en-GB: You keep bickering instead of looking for the traitor among you!

en: This is a grave accusation, senior deputy.
en-GB: This is a grave accusation, senior deputy.

en: Your chancellor led the charge against us in there.
en-GB: Your chancellor led the charge against us in there.

en: I'm truly sorry. But, I have some information that might interest you.
en-GB: I'm truly sorry. But, I have some information that might interest you.

en: It's about the secret cult of Arivad.
en-GB: It's about the secret cult of Arivad.

en: I admit, this is second-hand intelligence, but still...
en-GB: I admit, this is second-hand intelligence, but still...

en: One of my people saw a man with a tattoo...
en-GB: One of my people saw a man with a tattoo...

en: Yes. He followed the man all day, and to gathering that night...
en-GB: Yes. He followed the man all day, and to gathering that night...

en: ...in a remote village to the South.
en-GB: ...in a remote village to the South.

en: ...but you'll find it easily on any local map.
en-GB: ...but you'll find it easily on any local map.

en: You're welcome. Someone must take care of these cultists.
en-GB: You're welcome. Someone must take care of these cultists.

en: I understand how they see things, but…
en-GB: I understand how they see things, but…

en: The Council's still young. Everyone is angling for influence…
en-GB: The Council's still young. Everyone is angling for influence…

en: …but squabbling academics are better than clashing armies.
en-GB: …but squabbling academics are better than clashing armies.

en: Only Airgetine supported us? I mean, beside you.
en-GB: Only Airgetine supported us? I mean, beside you.

en: Why would the New Empire be the only friend we have in there?
en-GB: Why would the New Empire be the only friend we have in there?

en: Airgetine's a moderate, it's true, but the New Empire is subtle. Plans within plans.
en-GB: Airgetine's a moderate, it's true, but the New Empire is subtle. Plans within plans.

en: It's hard to say whether he was following orders or voting his conscience.
en-GB: It's hard to say whether he was following orders or voting his conscience.

en: I wouldn't read too much into his vote, at least for now.
en-GB: I wouldn't read too much into his vote, at least for now.

en: But what about you? How are you coping without the Crown?
en-GB: But what about you? How are you coping without the Crown?

en: Same for me, actually. It almost feels like we still have the Crown.
en-GB: Same for me, actually. It almost feels like we still have the Crown.

en: Exactly. We lost its magical power, but…
en-GB: Exactly. We lost its magical power, but…

en: Interesting. So the attunement is unaffected by physical separation?
en-GB: Interesting. So the attunement is unaffected by physical separation?

en: Keep the Crown safe, Marshal, will you, please?
en-GB: Keep the Crown safe, Marshal, will you, please?

en: Not drowning in your beer, today, Arwin?
en-GB: Not drowning in your beer, today, Arwin?

en: They took the Crown from you?
en-GB: They took the Crown from you?

en: How? You really think I'm just a drunk?
en-GB: How? You really think I'm just a drunk?

en: The whole Principality knows you have that Crown.
en-GB: The whole Principality knows you have that Crown.

en: You think we need you to tell us?
en-GB: You think we need you to tell us?

en: I mean something's up - something big.
en-GB: I mean something's up - something big.

en: Didn't you see what they can do?
en-GB: Didn't you see what they can do?

en: At first I thought you were just another bunch of brainless Council lackeys...
en-GB: At first I thought you were just another bunch of brainless Council lackeys...

en: At Coparran, and plenty other places, I'm sure.
en-GB: At Coparran, and plenty other places, I'm sure.

en: The way they get into people's heads.
en-GB: The way they get into people's heads.

en: I've watched the people of Caer Cyflen for ten years.
en-GB: I've watched the people of Caer Cyflen for ten years.

en: I've felt a change - slow, subtle...
en-GB: I've felt a change - slow, subtle...

en: So what? You're ready to become a hero again?
en-GB: So what? You're ready to become a hero again?

en: Are you offering to join us?
en-GB: Are you offering to join us?

en: That blade and I, we've slain countless abominations down there in the Badlands.
en-GB: That blade and I, we've slain countless abominations down there in the Badlands.

en: You helped me get closure for my lost child.
en-GB: You helped me get closure for my lost child.

en: You were at my side when we took down the remorhaz.
en-GB: You were at my side when we took down the remorhaz.

en: Yes, I'd like to join you.
en-GB: Yes, I'd like to join you.

en: Look, a farm! And another! High adventure - I love it!
en-GB: Look, a farm! And another! High adventure - I love it!

en: This doesn't exactly feel like the headquarters for a massive invasion.
en-GB: This doesn't exactly feel like the headquarters for a massive invasion.

en: Some headquarters. Dark cults used to be better.
en-GB: Some headquarters. Dark cults used to be better.

en: Not exactly how  I imagined the lair of evil Sorr-Akkath worshippers.
en-GB: Not exactly how I imagined the lair of evil Sorr-Akkath worshippers.

en: But it could be hiding a small group of infiltrators.
en-GB: But it could be hiding a small group of infiltrators.

en: Still, a good cover for cunning infiltrators.
en-GB: Still, a good cover for cunning infiltrators.

en: Let's look around for anything suspicious.
en-GB: Let's look around for anything suspicious.

en: Let us examine the area in search of clues.
en-GB: Let us examine the area in search of clues.

en: No tavern? That's suspicious, for a start.
en-GB: No tavern? That's suspicious, for a start.

en: Shut up! We're trying to be stealthy!
en-GB: Shut up! We're trying to be stealthy!

en: You'd better be quiet if you don't want us to be spotted.
en-GB: You'd better be quiet if you don't want us to be spotted.

en: Quiet, if you please. Let discretion be our watchword.
en-GB: Quiet, if you please. Let discretion be our watchword.

en: Footprints? Really? It's a village. People live here.
en-GB: Footprints? Really? It's a village. People live here.

en: Random footprints in a village? Not much of a clue.
en-GB: Random footprints in a village? Not much of a clue.

en: This is it! Be ready for anything.
en-GB: This is it! Be ready for anything.

en: That didn't feel like we surprised them.
en-GB: That didn't feel like we surprised them.

en: Yep, carefully set up to kill us - well, you, I guess.
en-GB: Yep, carefully set up to kill us - well, you, I guess.

en: He said the intelligence wasn't certain.
en-GB: He said the intelligence wasn't certain.

en: The Antiquarian? He told you about this place?
en-GB: The Antiquarian? He told you about this place?

en: Or just one of their agents.
en-GB: Or just one of their agents.

en: Or just one of their agents.
en-GB: Or just one of their agents.

en: Anyone checked him for a tattoo?
en-GB: Anyone checked him for a tattoo?

en: There's only one way to know for sure.
en-GB: There's only one way to know for sure.

en: Let's go back to Caer Cyflen.
en-GB: Let's go back to Caer Cyflen.

en: Is that the army? In the city?
en-GB: Is that the army? In the city?

en: I'd prefer to find Carran first.
en-GB: I'd prefer to find Carran first.

en: I have to check on someone. I'll catch you later.
en-GB: I have to check on someone. I'll catch you later.

en: I thought he had no friends left.
en-GB: I thought he had no friends left.

en: Hello, Karel! Have you seen Lord Carran?
en-GB: Hello, Karel! Have you seen Lord Carran?

en: Greetings, master Martel. Have you seen lord Carran recently?
en-GB: Greetings, master Martel. Have you seen lord Carran recently?

en: I know, it's been in the air, but now...
en-GB: I know, it's been in the air, but now...

en: ...rumors has it that Gallivan's armies are massing at the eastern border.
en-GB: ...rumours has it that Gallivan's armies are massing at the eastern border.

en: Ask your friends on the Council. They were supposed to keep the peace.
en-GB: Ask your friends on the Council. They were supposed to keep the peace.

en: Don't be ridiculous - I enlisted! Gets me the rank I deserve. Finally.
en-GB: Don't be ridiculous - I enlisted! Gets me the rank I deserve. Finally.

en: Captain? That's even higher than Beryl Stonebeard.
en-GB: Captain? That's even higher than Beryl Stonebeard.

en: I'd rather forget that time, fighting Soraks in that hellhole Caer Lem.
en-GB: I'd rather forget that time, fighting Soraks in that hellhole Caer Lem.

en: Gallivan's armies are honest foes - flesh, blood, and steel.
en-GB: Gallivan's armies are honest foes - flesh, blood, and steel.

en: You still here? I suppose we owe this mess to you?
en-GB: You still here? I suppose we owe this mess to you?

en: War. Or the threat of war.
en-GB: War. Or the threat of war.

en: Well, the Snow Alliance representatives are leaving.
en-GB: Well, the Snow Alliance representatives are leaving.

en: We don't want to be caught between Masgarth and Gallivan.
en-GB: We don't want to be caught between Masgarth and Gallivan.

en: I did my part. Didn't work.
en-GB: I did my part. Didn't work.

en: As soon as my dawdling cousin gives the order.
en-GB: As soon as my dawdling cousin gives the order.

en: Let's hope we can meet again, on the same side.
en-GB: Let's hope we can meet again, on the same side.

en: Cut the 'my' lady stuff, will you?
en-GB: Cut the 'my' lady stuff, will you?

en: Do we still need to play this game?
en-GB: Do we still need to play this game?

en: We prefer the old name: 'Silent Whisper.'
en-GB: We prefer the old name: 'Silent Whisper.'

en: The intelligence service of the Manacalon Empire? Really?
en-GB: The intelligence service of the Manacalon Empire? Really?

en: Nothing and no one, I'm afraid.
en-GB: Nothing and no one, I'm afraid.

en: I was looking for your...acquaintance, Halman Summer.
en-GB: I was looking for your...acquaintance, Halman Summer.

en: We were looking for him, too.
en-GB: We were looking for him, too.

en: The Antiquarians and the other Snow Alliance people are pulling out.
en-GB: The Antiquarians and the other Snow Alliance people are pulling out.

en: The Antiquarians are still packing up, though.
en-GB: The Antiquarians are still packing up, though.

en: We had eyes on him, but...we lost him.
en-GB: We had eyes on him, but...we lost him.

en: You should really get to the Council.
en-GB: You should really get to the Council.

en: The whole delegation from the Tower of Knowledge - they were poisoned!
en-GB: The whole delegation from the Tower of Knowledge - they were poisoned!

en: All of them, thirty-something, but that's not the point.
en-GB: All of them, thirty-something, but that's not the point.

en: After Dean Faisech accused the Council of...favoritism toward the Principality...
en-GB: After Dean Faisech accused the Council of...favouritism toward the Principality...

en: ...for keeping the Crown in Caer Cyflen.
en-GB: ...for keeping the Crown in Caer Cyflen.

en: At the temple of Einar, which is not affiliated with the Principality.
en-GB: At the temple of Einar, which is not affiliated with the Principality.

en: Yet, soon after, we all ate at the same table, but the Tower delegates died in their sleep.
en-GB: Yet, soon after, we all ate at the same table, but the Tower delegates died in their sleep.

en: Of course, Gallivan took it as an attack by the Principality.
en-GB: Of course, Gallivan took it as an attack by the Principality.

en: But that's why the Tower's on the Council, and not Gallivan's government - to avoid exactly that!
en-GB: But that's why the Tower's on the Council, and not Gallivan's government - to avoid exactly that!

en: You think I don't know that?

en: This is real politics, my friends - diplomacy is dead.

en: So the Legacy Council was a sham all along?

en: No! It was a real, honest effort to maintain peace.

en: But Gallivan's massing troops at the border.
en-GB: But Gallivan's massing troops at the border.

en: Bad news really does travel fast.

en: Anyway, pressure is growing for the Princess to...intervene.

en: Not as member of the Council. As head of state.

en: Chasing the Soraks and their pawns.
en-GB: Chasing the Soraks and their pawns.

en: Halman Summer might have been one of them.

en: What? The man was...I mean, I dined at his mansion recently...he...
en-GB: What? The man was...I mean, I dined at his mansion recently...he...

en: No - his family has a mansion in town.

en: Oddly, it's right next door to the Circle of Danantar's headquarters.

en: I might need you when you're done with this errand.

en: Not bad for a secret home.

en: And close to official buildings - who would suspect anything?

en: We're past that, don't you think?

en: Take care of Solasta. Take care of your world.
en-GB: Take care of Solasta. Take care of your world.

en: You're back! How did it go?
en-GB: You're back! How did it go?

en: Well… Captain Henrik is dead, I'm sorry.
en-GB: Well… Captain Henrik is dead, I'm sorry.

en: You might have to wait before going to Caer Lem, I'm afraid.
en-GB: You might have to wait before going to Caer Lem, I'm afraid.

en: Well, not your fault. Thanks for the heads-up.
en-GB: Well, not your fault. Thanks for the heads-up.

en: We wanted to talk about Caer Lem.
en-GB: We wanted to talk about Caer Lem.

en: Ah, you want to claim the place?
en-GB: Ah, you want to claim the place?

en: We go there and scavenge everything you didn't take, then you get a percentage.
en-GB: We go there and scavenge everything you didn't take, then you get a percentage.

en: We can't promise you it's safe.
en-GB: We can't promise you it's safe.

en: Once we get there, we'll set up an outpost of our own.
en-GB: Once we get there, we'll set up an outpost of our own.

en: I'll check with the Council first, but thanks anyway.
en-GB: I'll check with the Council first, but thanks anyway.

en: Once we've done our work, I'll let you know.
en-GB: Once we've done our work, I'll let you know.

en: You'll just have to come by and collect your share.
en-GB: You'll just have to come by and collect your share.

en: I think… this is what the Crown showed me.
en-GB: I think… this is what the Crown showed me.

en: So, not one of the gems?
en-GB: So, not one of the gems?

en: Let's go back to the Council. We have to tell them.
en-GB: Let's go back to the Council. We have to tell them.

en: I have great need of you, my friends.
en-GB: I have great need of you, my friends.

en: One of our teams has been attacked and is stranded in the Badlands.
en-GB: One of our teams has been attacked and is stranded in the Badlands.

en: It's a bit beyond Caer Lem, not that far into the Badlands.
en-GB: It's a bit beyond Caer Lem, not that far into the Badlands.

en: They found a legendary place - the lost city of Telema!
en-GB: They found a legendary place - the lost city of Telema!

en: No one really knows what it was, but the name appears in many old texts.
en-GB: No one really knows what it was, but the name appears in many old texts.

en: One of them came back yesterday...
en-GB: One of them came back yesterday...

en: He told me they'd been attacked and his leader sent him to get help.
en-GB: He told me they'd been attacked and his leader sent him to get help.

en: Alas, Telema is many days from here.
en-GB: Alas, Telema is many days from here.

en: Do you think they're still alive?
en-GB: Do you think they're still alive?

en: I don't know, but I'd like you to go and find out.
en-GB: I don't know, but I'd like you to go and find out.

en: If they're alive, bring them back.
en-GB: If they're alive, bring them back.

en: If not... I'll send for their bodies.
en-GB: If not... I'll send for their bodies.

en: Anyway, the place is yours to explore. I expect it contains many treasures.
en-GB: Anyway, the place is yours to explore. I expect it contains many treasures.

en: Well, I suppose we can do that for our friends the Scavengers.
en-GB: Well, I suppose we can do that for our friends the Scavengers.

en: That would make you part of the family, I promise.
en-GB: That would make you part of the family, I promise.

en: All right, let's hope we find them alive.
en-GB: All right, let's hope we find them alive.

en: Let's search him. We might find something to explain all this.
en-GB: Let's search him. We might find something to explain all this.

en: Are you thinking what I'm thinking?
en-GB: Are you thinking what I'm thinking?

en: At least we saved two of them.
en-GB: At least we saved two of them.

en: Let's go back and tell Annie.
en-GB: Let's go back and tell Annie.

en: Lena and Dek are already here?
en-GB: Lena and Dek are already here?

en: I received a message. They're safely back in Coparann.
en-GB: I received a message. They're safely back in Coparann.

en: So they told you about Hector.
en-GB: So they told you about Hector.

en: Never mind me. This was the Soraks, I know.
en-GB: Never mind me. This was the Soraks, I know.

en: Actually, we found proof that it was.
en-GB: Actually, we found proof that it was.

en: Oh... and you saved two of my kids, I shall never forget.
en-GB: Oh... and you saved two of my kids, I shall never forget.

en: We must go, Annie. See you!
en-GB: We must go, Annie. See you!

en: Are you the local… boss of the Scavengers?
en-GB: Are you the local… boss of the Scavengers?

en: Not boss of much, I'm afraid.
en-GB: Not boss of much, I'm afraid.

en: We used to have adventurers raiding around here, but now there's just one.
en-GB: We used to have adventurers raiding around here, but now there's just one.

en: She's around somewhere. You might run into her.
en-GB: She's around somewhere. You might run into her.

en: We did find an interesting place, though - an old Tirmarian monastery.
en-GB: We did find an interesting place, though - an old Tirmarian monastery.

en: Tell me where. We'll take care of it.
en-GB: Tell me where. We'll take care of it.

en: May the owl watch over you, faithful one.
en-GB: May the owl watch over you, faithful one.

en: May you find the answers you seek, adventurers.
en-GB: May you find the answers you seek, adventurers.

en: Lady of life! A follower of the goddess.
en-GB: Lady of life! A follower of the goddess.

en: Hem. Well, a renowned mind of Caer Cyflen has asked to see you.
en-GB: Hem. Well, a renowned mind of Caer Cyflen has asked to see you.

en: I believe you know him - Galeafin Pureheart?
en-GB: I believe you know him - Galeafin Pureheart?

en: Indeed! A very fine mind and a beloved teacher!
en-GB: Indeed! A very fine mind and a beloved teacher!

en: Well, he's heard about your exploits and would like to talk to you.
en-GB: Well, he's heard about your exploits and would like to talk to you.

en: Gladly! It will be good to see my old teacher! Clear skies!
en-GB: Gladly! It will be good to see my old teacher! Clear skies!

en: Clear skies! We would like to meet Master Pureheart!
en-GB: Clear skies! We would like to meet Master Pureheart!

en: You don't have an appointment? Who shall I announce?
en-GB: You don't have an appointment? Who shall I announce?

en: A companion of the third enlightenment!
en-GB: A companion of the third enlightenment!

en: Clear skies, my student! To what do I owe the pleasure?
en-GB: Clear skies, my student! To what do I owe the pleasure?

en: Mayor Bright-Spark asked us to visit you.
en-GB: Mayor Bright-Spark asked us to visit you.

en: Ah yes, this matter for the Council!
en-GB: Ah yes, this matter for the Council!

en: The matter of evil, and what motivates people to choose evil.
en-GB: The matter of evil, and what motivates people to choose evil.

en: Yes, and I need your help! Tell me about your missions!
en-GB: Yes, and I need your help! Tell me about your missions!

en: I am cleared to hear everything!
en-GB: I am cleared to hear everything!

en: Well… it all began at Caer Lem…
en-GB: Well… it all began at Caer Lem…

en: Many thanks! You gave me much to ponder. We shall meet again soon!
en-GB: Many thanks! You gave me much to ponder. We shall meet again soon!

en: Clear skies, Master Pureheart. You sent for us?
en-GB: Clear skies, Master Pureheart. You sent for us?

en: Yes, indeed! I would like more…
en-GB: Yes, indeed! I would like more…

en: …details about your dealings with the Sorr-Akkath.
en-GB: …details about your dealings with the Sorr-Akkath.

en: You gave me much to consider. But I need more…
en-GB: You gave me much to consider. But I need more…

en: There is much talk about Sorr-Akkath cruelty…
en-GB: There is much talk about Sorr-Akkath cruelty…

en: Did you witness it first hand?
en-GB: Did you witness it first hand?

en: Alas, quite often! When they fight…
en-GB: Alas, quite often! When they fight…

en: They enjoy inflicting pain before killing!
en-GB: They enjoy inflicting pain before killing!

en: But why, why so much suffering?
en-GB: But why, why so much suffering?

en: We think it is the will of their god, Sorr-Tarr.
en-GB: We think it is the will of their god, Sorr-Tarr.

en: He expects them to spread terror…
en-GB: He expects them to spread terror…

en: … from what we understand of them!
en-GB: … from what we understand of them!

en: And so he relies on cruelty to… to do what?
en-GB: And so he relies on cruelty to… to do what?

en: To gain a hold! Those he can't control, he blackmails or breaks their will!
en-GB: To gain a hold! Those he can't control, he blackmails or breaks their will!

en: I have had occasion to witness… certain things.
en-GB: I have had occasion to witness… certain things.

en: I am not entirely sure. Violent rituals…
en-GB: I am not entirely sure. Violent rituals…

en: …they reminded me of what you said.
en-GB: …they reminded me of what you said.

en: I need to think! Can you come back tomorrow?
en-GB: I need to think! Can you come back tomorrow?

en: You realize something very bad might be happening to him?
en-GB: You realise something very bad might be happening to him?

en: I know. Let's just… come back tomorrow.
en-GB: I know. Let's just… come back tomorrow.

en: Ah, my friend. Let me introduce Lady Illoreth, my paramour!
en-GB: Ah, my friend. Let me introduce Lady Illoreth, my paramour!

en: Why do you call us that?
en-GB: Why do you call us that?

en: Because you are the reason I was sent after Galeafin, the most gentle soul on Solasta.
en-GB: Because you are the reason I was sent after Galeafin, the most gentle soul on Solasta.

en: I knew there was some treachery afoot here!
en-GB: I knew there was some treachery afoot here!

en: I am an infiltrator from the Coven of Arivad!
en-GB: I am an infiltrator from the Coven of Arivad!

en: I was to seduce Galeafin to make him work for us!
en-GB: I was to seduce Galeafin to make him work for us!

en: He showed me that even a corrupted soul like mine still had some good.
en-GB: He showed me that even a corrupted soul like mine still had some good.

en: And I won't let any harm come to him!
en-GB: And I won't let any harm come to him!

en: The Coven will soon ask me to bring him in to turn him!
en-GB: The Coven will soon ask me to bring him in to turn him!

en: I can take you there - right to a splinter cell of the Coven!
en-GB: I can take you there - right to a splinter cell of the Coven!

en: Just to be free - to make a new life somewhere else.
en-GB: Just to be free - to make a new life somewhere else.

en: We are too well known to stay here, but we want to stay together!
en-GB: We are too well known to stay here, but we want to stay together!

en: The Coven knew of your mission and sent me to get information from you…
en-GB: The Coven knew of your mission and sent me to get information from you…

en: I am not sure I am the only agent who knows…
en-GB: I am not sure I am the only agent who knows…

en: …and Galeafin must disappear to be safe.
en-GB: …and Galeafin must disappear to be safe.

en: Do you truly want to leave, Master?
en-GB: Do you truly want to leave, Master?

en: Yes. Where Illoreth goes, I shall follow!
en-GB: Yes. Where Illoreth goes, I shall follow!

en: Very well, we shall come when you send for us!
en-GB: Very well, we shall come when you send for us!

en: And until then, let me speak.
en-GB: And until then, let me speak.

en: We're running late! Are we the last?
en-GB: We're running late! Are we the last?

en: Yes! All are awaiting your guest.
en-GB: Yes! All are awaiting your guest.

en: It's one at a time, you know the rules!
en-GB: It's one at a time, you know the rules!

en: Let me guess - that was the signal!
en-GB: Let me guess - that was the signal!

en: Look at this! Marshal Sunblaze will be delighted!
en-GB: Look at this! Marshal Sunblaze will be delighted!

en: I suppose she grabbed her reward… she ran.
en-GB: I suppose she grabbed her reward… she ran.

en: May your wisdom serve you well, now.
en-GB: May your wisdom serve you well, now.

en: Someone here worshipped Arun, a long time ago.
en-GB: Someone here worshipped Arun, a long time ago.

en: That someone ruined their own shrine?
en-GB: That someone ruined their own shrine?

en: Maybe it was just the cataclysm.
en-GB: Maybe it was just the cataclysm.

en: Clear skies, Chaplain Lark! You wanted to see me?
en-GB: Clear skies, Chaplain Lark! You wanted to see me?

en: Clear skies! Yes, thanks for coming so quickly!
en-GB: Clear skies! Yes, thanks for coming so quickly!

en: Chaplain Ardentfire, Priest of Arun, would like to talk to you about it.
en-GB: Chaplain Ardentfire, Priest of Arun, would like to talk to you about it.

en: I shall go to him right away! Clear skies!
en-GB: I shall go to him right away! Clear skies!

en: Even if I don't pray to Arun, I'm happy to be of service.
en-GB: Even if I don't pray to Arun, I'm happy to be of service.

en: Clear skies! Einar guards you all!
en-GB: Clear skies! Einar guards you all!

en: Chaplain Dalon Lark told us you'd like to talk?
en-GB: Chaplain Dalon Lark told us you'd like to talk?

en: The Scavengers said that many tombs in the cemetery bore the name of the Darwaz family.
en-GB: The Scavengers said that many tombs in the cemetery bore the name of the Darwaz family.

en: He was a renowned prelate on Tirmar.
en-GB: He was a renowned prelate on Tirmar.

en: The heads of the Church searched for him for years.
en-GB: The heads of the Church searched for him for years.

en: Then he was thought to be lost, either left on the home world…
en-GB: Then he was thought to be lost, either left on the home world…

en: Now, we know he was alive - he buried his brothers and family in the Badlands!
en-GB: Now, we know he was alive - he buried his brothers and family in the Badlands!

en: Worse. As this cursed symbol suggests.
en-GB: Worse. As this cursed symbol suggests.

en: I prayed for his soul, and Arun sent me a sign.
en-GB: I prayed for his soul, and Arun sent me a sign.

en: Chaplain Darwaz' soul never joined Arun. It is trapped.
en-GB: Chaplain Darwaz' soul never joined Arun. It is trapped.

en: He might have cursed his own symbol.
en-GB: He might have cursed his own symbol.

en: The souls of his brothers also wander, somewhere in this land.
en-GB: The souls of his brothers also wander, somewhere in this land.

en: Someone must go and cleanse their remains with holy water.
en-GB: Someone must go and cleanse their remains with holy water.

en: Not if Emtan is indeed cursed - his soul will be too angry.
en-GB: Not if Emtan is indeed cursed - his soul will be too angry.

en: Then you'll need to reason with him. I imbued his symbol with Arun's magic - use it as proof.
en-GB: Then you'll need to reason with him. I imbued his symbol with Arun's magic - use it as proof.

en: And if he doesn't listen to reason?
en-GB: And if he doesn't listen to reason?

en: Then - and only then - you will have to destroy him.
en-GB: Then - and only then - you will have to destroy him.

en: We will do what is necessary.
en-GB: We will do what is necessary.

en: May Arun's fire warm your heart!
en-GB: May Arun's fire warm your heart!

en: Did we forget to close the door on our last visit?
en-GB: Did we forget to close the door on our last visit?

en: Let's cleanse those tombs with holy water!
en-GB: Let's cleanse those tombs with holy water!

en: Not many remains left for the prayer!
en-GB: Not many remains left for the prayer!

en: You had to say it! Get ready, people!
en-GB: You had to say it! Get ready, people!

en: We're not going to try talking to them first?
en-GB: We're not going to try talking to them first?

en: No harm in trying, I guess.
en-GB: No harm in trying, I guess.

en: May the light of the gods free your souls!
en-GB: May the light of the gods free your souls!

en: Sheesh! Don't pray for me if I die!
en-GB: Sheesh! Don't pray for me if I die!

en: Who are you to disturb our eternal rest?
en-GB: Who are you to disturb our eternal rest?

en: A follower of the gods, hoping to save your soul!
en-GB: A follower of the gods, hoping to save your soul!

en: There are no gods in this place, fool!
en-GB: There are no gods in this place, fool!

en: Of course! Otherwise, they would have answered us in our hour of need!
en-GB: Of course! Otherwise, they would have answered us in our hour of need!

en: I prayed and no answer came!
en-GB: I prayed and no answer came!

en: Did you not have water and the means to grow food?
en-GB: Did you not have water and the means to grow food?

en: Were monsters not kept at bay from your valley?
en-GB: Were monsters not kept at bay from your valley?

en: We heard them roaming around at night!
en-GB: We heard them roaming around at night!

en: Weren't you spared the worst of the mana collapse?
en-GB: Weren't you spared the worst of the mana collapse?

en: And yet you survived how many years here?
en-GB: And yet you survived how many years here?

en: Yes, they were! You were just too mad with grief to see it!
en-GB: Yes, they were! You were just too mad with grief to see it!

en: Behold, the power of Arun, apostate!
en-GB: Behold, the power of Arun, apostate!

en: Arun! The lord is still here!
en-GB: Arun! The lord is still here!

en: It is time for you to enjoy your final rest, Emtan Darwaz, Acolyte of Arun!
en-GB: It is time for you to enjoy your final rest, Emtan Darwaz, Acolyte of Arun!

en: Clear skies! Did you bring peace to those troubled souls?
en-GB: Clear skies! Did you bring peace to those troubled souls?

en: Yes, all of them are with the gods now!
en-GB: Yes, all of them are with the gods now!

en: Many thanks, I will call his name during prayers!
en-GB: Many thanks, I will call his name during prayers!

en: Tragedy. The curse of Sorr-Tarr hurts us, still.
en-GB: Tragedy. The curse of Sorr-Tarr hurts us, still.

en: We couldn't bring him back. He's gone.
en-GB: We couldn't bring him back. He's gone.

en: You were at the embassy! An aide or something…
en-GB: You were at the embassy! An aide or something…

en: You're mistaken. I'm a Council deputy.
en-GB: You're mistaken. I'm a Council deputy.

en: You can't fool me, I never forget a face.
en-GB: You can't fool me, I never forget a face.

en: That same week, the Gallivan envoy somehow got hold of our plans for the trade treaty…
en-GB: That same week, the Gallivan envoy somehow got hold of our plans for the trade treaty…

en: Stop bothering us - we're guests of the princess.
en-GB: Stop bothering us - we're guests of the princess.

en: He's a Belmont. Be careful - they're a powerful family in the Snow Alliance.
en-GB: He's a Belmont. Be careful - they're a powerful family in the Snow Alliance.

en: This isn't over. Now I found you, we'll settle this!
en-GB: This isn't over. Now I found you, we'll settle this!

en: Look, if this is going to be a problem, we need to fix it - together.
en-GB: Look, if this is going to be a problem, we need to fix it - together.

en: All right, then I'll need to see someone at the Gallivan embassy.
en-GB: All right, then I'll need to see someone at the Gallivan embassy.

en: I'd like to see ambassador Crawley.
en-GB: I'd like to see ambassador Crawley.

en: I'll be damned. Senior deputy of the Legacy Council.
en-GB: I'll be damned. Senior deputy of the Legacy Council.

en: Can't say I expected your visit.
en-GB: Can't say I expected your visit.

en: I bumped into Belmont at the Palace residence.
en-GB: I bumped into Belmont at the Palace residence.

en: He seems to suspect me over the stolen treaty plans.
en-GB: He seems to suspect me over the stolen treaty plans.

en: He's pretty eager to pin it on me.
en-GB: He's pretty eager to pin it on me.

en: You have to take him out.
en-GB: You have to take him out.

en: I can suggest a course of action.
en-GB: I can suggest a course of action.

en: You just need to plant something in the New Empire's embassy.
en-GB: You just need to plant something in the New Empire's embassy.

en: Unless you have friends in the Silent Whisper.
en-GB: Unless you have friends in the Silent Whisper.

en: Once it's in the right hands, this will kill our friend Belmont's credibility.
en-GB: Once it's in the right hands, this will kill our friend Belmont's credibility.

en: It looks like you have this all figured out.
en-GB: It looks like you have this all figured out.

en: I always plan for every contingency.
en-GB: I always plan for every contingency.

en: Then this time it's farewell for good.
en-GB: Then this time it's farewell for good.

en: You really want to break into the New Empire's embassy?
en-GB: You really want to break into the New Empire's embassy?

en: We can ask Daliat. I think he'll help us.
en-GB: We can ask Daliat. I think he'll help us.

en: Sewers? Really? How did you know about this?
en-GB: Sewers? Really? How did you know about this?

en: Mind your own business. This way. Stay low.
en-GB: Mind your own business. This way. Stay low.

en: Remember, if we're discovered, we're as good as dead.
en-GB: Remember, if we're discovered, we're as good as dead.

en: I'm not your colleague, Daliat. You know that.
en-GB: I'm not your colleague, Daliat. You know that.

en: Sure. What can I do for you?
en-GB: Sure. What can I do for you?

en: We have something on Belmont that you might like. Not flattering.
en-GB: We have something on Belmont that you might like. Not flattering.

en: I need you to release it right away.
en-GB: I need you to release it right away.

en: I'll need you to do something for me, then.
en-GB: I'll need you to do something for me, then.

en: Some… former colleagues are running an operation from a base nearby.
en-GB: Some… former colleagues are running an operation from a base nearby.

en: They're traitors to the Silent Whisper. Ruthless bastards, too.
en-GB: They're traitors to the Silent Whisper. Ruthless bastards, too.

en: Enough to die, just like that?
en-GB: Enough to die, just like that?

en: Your choice. Do this for me and I'll take care of the Belmont thing.
en-GB: Your choice. Do this for me and I'll take care of the Belmont thing.

en: It's done. Your… friends won't be a problem anymore.
en-GB: It's done. Your… friends won't be a problem anymore.

en: Good! I knew I could depend on you.
en-GB: Good! I knew I could depend on you.

en: That tip on Belmont is so good. He's as good as dead.
en-GB: That tip on Belmont is so good. He's as good as dead.

en: Pleasure working with you, my friends.
en-GB: Pleasure working with you, my friends.

en: Clear skies, friends! I have a letter for someone who fought at Sandreed.
en-GB: Clear skies, friends! I have a letter for someone who fought at Sandreed.

en: That'd be me. Who wrote me?
en-GB: That'd be me. Who wrote me?

en: Mildred Warmhearth, innkeeper at Coparann's Strike True tavern. Know her?
en-GB: Mildred Warmhearth, innkeeper at Coparann's Strike True tavern. Know her?

en: Sure do. Well, friends, who's in for a trip back there?
en-GB: Sure do. Well, friends, who's in for a trip back there?

en: Clear skies to you, adventurers! You got my letter?
en-GB: Clear skies to you, adventurers! You got my letter?

en: Clear skies! What's it all about?
en-GB: Clear skies! What's it all about?

en: Well, I knew your parents - and I know about the events that led to their deaths!
en-GB: Well, I knew your parents - and I know about the events that led to their deaths!

en: Sure did. They had a house in the Vale, you know.
en-GB: Sure did. They had a house in the Vale, you know.

en: I wasn't sure the first time I saw you… now I am.
en-GB: I wasn't sure the first time I saw you… now I am.

en: Your parents were merchants, and you sometimes traveled with them.
en-GB: Your parents were merchants, and you sometimes travelled with them.

en: They worked a circuit from the Principality to the Marches.
en-GB: They worked a circuit from the Principality to the Marches.

en: So the house belongs to you now, I guess!
en-GB: So the house belongs to you now, I guess!

en: What events? What are you talking about?
en-GB: What events? What are you talking about?

en: Fifteen years ago, Coparann was threatened by an orcish horde.
en-GB: Fifteen years ago, Coparann was threatened by an orcish horde.

en: They hit us hard, and almost overran the defenses!
en-GB: They hit us hard, and almost overran the defences!

en: If the Stonefist company hadn't shown up when they did…
en-GB: If the Stonefist company hadn't shown up when they did…

en: They broke the siege, but we'd already lost a lot of people.
en-GB: They broke the siege, but we'd already lost a lot of people.

en: They died right after the siege.
en-GB: They died right after the siege.

en: No… I… How can I put this?
en-GB: No… I… How can I put this?

en: Well, your parents had been spying for the orcs!
en-GB: Well, your parents had been spying for the orcs!

en: It was you. Your testimony sealed their fate.
en-GB: It was you. Your testimony sealed their fate.

en: A seemingly innocent remark, but it led the Ceannard's spymaster to suspect your parents.
en-GB: A seemingly innocent remark, but it led the Ceannard's spymaster to suspect your parents.

en: How is it possible that I don't remember any of it?
en-GB: How is it possible that I don't remember any of it?

en: The Ceannard took pity on you and made you drink an elixir of forgetfulness.
en-GB: The Ceannard took pity on you and made you drink an elixir of forgetfulness.

en: Very potent, clearly. I don't remember shit from my childhood.
en-GB: Very potent, clearly. I don't remember shit from my childhood.

en: Yes. The Ceannard miscalculated the dose.
en-GB: Yes. The Ceannard miscalculated the dose.
