en-GB: Of course! It's just bad luck that you got everything.

en: Talk to my lawyer. Oh, wait…
en-GB: Talk to my lawyer. Oh, wait…

en: He needs a smack in the mouth.
en-GB: He needs a smack in the mouth.

en: I'll give him something to grieve over.
en-GB: I'll give him something to grieve over.

en: Lyria, I'm so very sorry for your loss.
en-GB: Lyria, I'm so very sorry for your loss.

en: Oh - you're the… well… I knew she liked you, but…
en-GB: Oh - you're the… well… I knew she liked you, but…

en: Frankly, this all seems like a prank.
en-GB: Frankly, this all seems like a prank.

en: Right? That's what I told the notary.
en-GB: Right? That's what I told the notary.

en: Thanks for asking. A bit down, of course.
en-GB: Thanks for asking. A bit down, of course.

en: I know. She was proud of you.
en-GB: I know. She was proud of you.

en: Listen - this will. It bothers me…
en-GB: Listen - this will. It bothers me…

en: …I really don't want to quarrel with you and your siblings.
en-GB: …I really don't want to quarrel with you and your siblings.

en: I'm afraid you won't have a choice.
en-GB: I'm afraid you won't have a choice.

en: Lyria is a lying bitch, and Drew is a tactless jerk.
en-GB: Lyria is a lying bitch, and Drew is a tactless jerk.

en: What would you do with the inheritance?
en-GB: What would you do with the inheritance?

en: Me? Share it with the two other sharks, just to stay alive.
en-GB: Me? Share it with the two other sharks, just to stay alive.

en: Stay alert. The notary's mansion might not be safe either.
en-GB: Stay alert. The notary's mansion might not be safe either.

en: So you left Caer Cyflen without a word.
en-GB: So you left Caer Cyflen without a word.

en: Just tell us what you decided and stop wasting our time.
en-GB: Just tell us what you decided and stop wasting our time.

en: At least share the inheritance. I need it for my research.
en-GB: At least share the inheritance. I need it for my research.

en: The Circle of Danantar will reward you.
en-GB: The Circle of Danantar will reward you.

en: Yeah, right. That inheritance will give me enough to get married…
en-GB: Yeah, right. That inheritance will give me enough to get married…

en: My father-in-law to be is very influential in the Tower of Knowledge, you know.
en-GB: My father-in-law to be is very influential in the Tower of Knowledge, you know.

en: I respect Mother's decision. It's all yours.
en-GB: I respect Mother's decision. It's all yours.

en: What? Did the Soraks replace you or something?
en-GB: What? Did the Soraks replace you or something?

en: Even from you, Drew, that's low.
en-GB: Even from you, Drew, that's low.

en: Ah, so you are all here.
en-GB: Ah, so you are all here.

en: Choose an heir from among the children.
en-GB: Choose an heir from among the children.
Split the inheritance between the children.

en: Your mother left me everything. Her will should be respected.
en-GB: Your mother left me everything. Her will should be respected.

en: We'll split the inheritance between the four of us.
en-GB: We'll split the inheritance between the four of us.

en: You should each get a third of the inheritance.
en-GB: You should each get a third of the inheritance.

en: Thank you! I'll share with you both, you know it.
en-GB: Thank you! I'll share with you both, you know it.

en: I will magically seal the will.
en-GB: I will magically seal the will.

en: I'm sorry, the law forbids it.
en-GB: I'm sorry, the law forbids it.

en: You can share it after you accept it, but there must be one single heir.
en-GB: You can share it after you accept it, but there must be one single heir.

en: Fine… I thought I had cracked you…
en-GB: Fine… I thought I had cracked you…

en: Sorry, sir, this will have to be done outside the law, I'm afraid.
en-GB: Sorry, sir, this will have to be done outside the law, I'm afraid.

en: Maybe she was a Sorak agent?
en-GB: Maybe she was a Sorak agent?

en: They were all my childhood friends…
en-GB: They were all my childhood friends…

en: Who's this? Seems to like wolves.
en-GB: Who's this? Seems to like wolves.

en: Could be a ranger. Could be a werewolf. Could be something else.
en-GB: Could be a ranger. Could be a werewolf. Could be something else.

en: Just someone else to kill. No one out here is friendly, remember?
en-GB: Just someone else to kill. No one out here is friendly, remember?

en: Maybe he knows something about the castle. It can't hurt to ask.
en-GB: Maybe he knows something about the castle. It can't hurt to ask.

en: Out here, there's no such thing as "can't hurt."
en-GB: Out here, there's no such thing as "can't hurt."

en: Didn't your mother tell you never to talk to strangers?
en-GB: Didn't your mother tell you never to talk to strangers?

en: We're not here to make friends, and we have enough enemies. Let's just go!
en-GB: We're not here to make friends, and we have enough enemies. Let's just go!

en: He might know something about the castle. It can't hurt to ask.
en-GB: He might know something about the castle. It can't hurt to ask.

en: Hello! We come in peace! Can we talk to you?
en-GB: Hello! We come in peace! Can we talk to you?

en: Talk, then. And stay where you are. I can hear you well enough from here.
en-GB: Talk, then. And stay where you are. I can hear you well enough from here.

en: We're… interested in the castle. Can you tell us anything about it?
en-GB: We're… interested in the castle. Can you tell us anything about it?

en: Not much. What do you want to know?
en-GB: Not much. What do you want to know?

en: You come in peace, do you? Then you're the only peaceful things here.
en-GB: You come in peace, do you? Then you're the only peaceful things here.

en: Go in peace, before I get tired of being peaceful.
en-GB: Go in peace, before I get tired of being peaceful.

en: I can hear you fine from here. What do you want?
en-GB: I can hear you fine from here. What do you want?

en: What do you know about that castle over there?
en-GB: What do you know about that castle over there?

en: What do you want to know?
en-GB: What do you want to know?

en: Believe me, you don't want me coming over there.
en-GB: Believe me, you don't want me coming over there.

en: Now get lost, before I change my mind!
en-GB: Now get lost, before I change my mind!

en: Who lives there? What can you tell us about them?
en-GB: Who lives there? What can you tell us about them?

en: I deal with the guard captain. Name's Adam the Twelfth. Undead now.
en-GB: I deal with the guard captain. Name's Adam the Twelfth. Undead now.

en: He lets us hunt here and we tell him who comes and goes.
en-GB: He lets us hunt here and we tell him who comes and goes.

en: Sounds like a good arrangement. So you've never been inside the castle?
en-GB: Sounds like a good arrangement. So you've never been inside the castle?

en: And there's no one else outside the castle?
en-GB: And there's no one else outside the castle?

en: Just a ghost - a dwarf. Doesn't seem dangerous.
en-GB: Just a ghost - a dwarf. Doesn't seem dangerous.

en: What's the garrison like? Strong? Weak? Monsters?
en-GB: What's the garrison like? Strong? Weak? Monsters?

en: The captain's a wraith, or something similar. The guard's mostly skeletons.
en-GB: The captain's a wraith, or something similar. The guard's mostly skeletons.

en: That's what I've seen from outside. Never been inside.
en-GB: That's what I've seen from outside. Never been inside.

en: Who rules the castle? Or should I rather ask what?
en-GB: Who rules the castle? Or should I rather ask what?

en: Name's Mardracht. Probably undead, but I never met him.
en-GB: Name's Mardracht. Probably undead, but I never met him.

en: Probably undead? Why do you say that?
en-GB: Probably undead? Why do you say that?

en: Undead or a necromancer, is my guess. Everyone I've seen there is undead.
en-GB: Undead or a necromancer, is my guess. Everyone I've seen there is undead.

en: Many thanks for the information, uh - I didn't catch your name?
en-GB: Many thanks for the information, uh - I didn't catch your name?

en: Some kind of incorporeal being - undead, most likely.
en-GB: Some kind of incorporeal being - undead, most likely.

en: Look! That must be the dwarf ghost we heard about!
en-GB: Look! That must be the dwarf ghost we heard about!

en: The undead are an affront to nature! They must be destroyed!
en-GB: The undead are an affront to nature! They must be destroyed!

en: An unnecessary fight is an unnecessary risk. Let's move on.
en-GB: An unnecessary fight is an unnecessary risk. Let's move on.

en: I'll take information where I can get it - even from a ghost.
en-GB: I'll take information where I can get it - even from a ghost.

en: Hello! Could we ask you some questions?
en-GB: Hello! Could we ask you some questions?

en: Hello! Are you the Antiquarian we've heard about?
en-GB: Hello! Are you the Antiquarian we've heard about?

en: Hello! I am Angbi Kramsson, of the Guild of Antiquarians. Or at least, I used to be.
en-GB: Hello! I am Angbi Kramsson, of the Guild of Antiquarians. Or at least, I used to be.

en: Hey, you - ghost! Get over here!
en-GB: Hey, you - ghost! Get over here!

en: All right. There's no need to be rude. What do you want?
en-GB: All right. There's no need to be rude. What do you want?

en: What are you going to do - kill me? Just - leave me alone.
en-GB: What are you going to do - kill me? Just - leave me alone.

en: What can you tell us about the castle? Who lives there?
en-GB: What can you tell us about the castle? Who lives there?

en: Two women. A high elf, but living, and quite old. She is a necromancer of some sort.
en-GB: Two women. A high elf, but living, and quite old. She is a necromancer of some sort.

en: Once human, but definitely undead now. A Defiler, I think…
en-GB: Once human, but definitely undead now. A Defiler, I think…

en: …and she had a gang of ghouls with her. Horrid beasts. I avoided them.
en-GB: …and she had a gang of ghouls with her. Horrid beasts. I avoided them.

en: There's a garrison - skeletons, mostly. I avoided them, too.
en-GB: There's a garrison - skeletons, mostly. I avoided them, too.

en: Actually, I was hoping to ask you a greater favor.
en-GB: Actually, I was hoping to ask you a greater favour.

en: I was killed in this cemetery. My bones are here somewhere.
en-GB: I was killed in this cemetery. My bones are here somewhere.

en: And you'd like us to take them home for burial, so you can find peace.
en-GB: And you'd like us to take them home for burial, so you can find peace.

en: Well, yes - but they got a little scattered. The wolves, you see.
en-GB: Well, yes - but they got a little scattered. The wolves, you see.

en: As far as I can… feel, they are in three separate places.
en-GB: As far as I can… feel, they are in three separate places.

en: Well, that's just you all over!
en-GB: Well, that's just you all over!

en: It's not just about burial, although of course I'd be grateful for that, too.
en-GB: It's not just about burial, although of course I'd be grateful for that, too.

en: Since I was killed, I've carried on studying this necropolis…
en-GB: Since I was killed, I've carried on studying this necropolis…

en: …but I can't touch material things, including pens - so I haven't been able to update my journal.
en-GB: …but I can't touch material things, including pens - so I haven't been able to update my journal.

en: Now, that's what I call work ethic.
en-GB: Now, that's what I call work ethic.

en: And since my spirit is bound to my mortal remains…
en-GB: And since my spirit is bound to my mortal remains…

en: …I can't return to Caer Cyflen to report in person.
en-GB: …I can't return to Caer Cyflen to report in person.

en: But if you take my bones back, perhaps my spirit could travel with them…
en-GB: But if you take my bones back, perhaps my spirit could travel with them…

en: …and the knowledge I've recovered won't be lost.
en-GB: …and the knowledge I've recovered won't be lost.

en: We will do as you ask, Angbi Kramsson of the Antiquarians!
en-GB: We will do as you ask, Angbi Kramsson of the Antiquarians!

en: Delegate Summer! May we speak with you?
en-GB: Delegate Summer! May we speak with you?

en: Angbi? Angbi Kramsson? Is that you?
en-GB: Angbi? Angbi Kramsson? Is that you?

en: It is. Or was. Anyway, I'm here.
en-GB: It is. Or was. Anyway, I'm here.

en: These kind deputies brought my bones back, and my spirit came with them.
en-GB: These kind deputies brought my bones back, and my spirit came with them.

en: Thank you, deputies. I am in your debt, and so is the Guild of Antiquarians.
en-GB: Thank you, deputies. I am in your debt, and so is the Guild of Antiquarians.

en: On behalf of the Guild, let me offer you something for your trouble.
en-GB: On behalf of the Guild, let me offer you something for your trouble.

en: I will make sure you go home to your family for burial, Angbi.
en-GB: I will make sure you go home to your family for burial, Angbi.

en: Thank you, Halman. But before you do, I'd like to make my report.
en-GB: Thank you, Halman. But before you do, I'd like to make my report.

en: One advantage of being a ghost is the ability to walk through walls, you see…
en-GB: One advantage of being a ghost is the ability to walk through walls, you see…

en: …so after my death, I was able to conduct a very thorough survey of an Imperial necropolis.
en-GB: …so after my death, I was able to conduct a very thorough survey of an Imperial necropolis.

en: I couldn't lift a pen to write it down, so I'll report in person. If that's acceptable.
en-GB: I couldn't lift a pen to write it down, so I'll report in person. If that's acceptable.

en: Well… I… let me take you to the Chancellor. She will want to know.
en-GB: Well… I… let me take you to the Chancellor. She will want to know.

en: Capital! We're distant cousins, you know.
en-GB: Capital! We're distant cousins, you know.

en: He's not the listening type, I can tell. We should leave and try another approach.
en-GB: He's not the listening type, I can tell. We should leave and try another approach.

en: It's just a few skeletons. Let's get 'em!
en-GB: It's just a few skeletons. Let's get 'em!

en: Look, I can tell you're a very important and, ah…
en-GB: Look, I can tell you're a very important and, ah…

en: Will you at least hear us before we go?
en-GB: Will you at least hear us before we go?

en: …long-serving officer, so I won't waste your time…
en-GB: …long-serving officer, so I won't waste your time…

en: …the fact is, I'm with the Imperial intelligence service.
en-GB: …the fact is, I'm with the Imperial intelligence service.

en: The others don't know, but our mission has been ordered by the Emperor himself.
en-GB: The others don't know, but our mission has been ordered by the Emperor himself.

en: Our orders are to meet with your master and ask him certain questions. Nothing more than that.
en-GB: Our orders are to meet with your master and ask him certain questions. Nothing more than that.

en: It's not up to me. You'll have to deal with the others in the keep.
en-GB: It's not up to me. You'll have to deal with the others in the keep.

en: I may be dead, but I'm not stupid.
en-GB: I may be dead, but I'm not stupid.

en: The Empire fell a thousand years ago. There is no Emperor.
en-GB: The Empire fell a thousand years ago. There is no Emperor.

en: Take your lies and get out!
en-GB: Take your lies and get out!

en: We understand that your master values his privacy, and we respect that.
en-GB: We understand that your master values his privacy, and we respect that.

en: You may not have heard of the Legacy Council, but…
en-GB: You may not have heard of the Legacy Council, but…

en: I know the name. That dwarf - Antiquarian, or whatever he calls himself - they sent him too.
en-GB: I know the name. That dwarf - Antiquarian, or whatever he calls himself - they sent him too.

en: I'll tell you what I told him: your Council has no authority here, and the master does not receive visitors!
en-GB: I'll tell you what I told him: your Council has no authority here, and the master does not receive visitors!

en: I don't know how you got in, but either you leave peacefully, or…
en-GB: I don't know how you got in, but either you leave peacefully, or…

en: We know that your master is very learned and powerful. We just want to ask him about something, that's all.
en-GB: We know that your master is very learned and powerful. We just want to ask him about something, that's all.

en: You want to steal from him, more like!
en-GB: You want to steal from him, more like!

en: Who are you? What do you want?
en-GB: Who are you? What do you want?

en: Give me one good reason why we shouldn't kill you right here.
en-GB: Give me one good reason why we shouldn't kill you right here.

en: Tell me what you want, and I'll think about it.
en-GB: Tell me what you want, and I'll think about it.

en: I know this place. You don't. Let's trade.
en-GB: I know this place. You don't. Let's trade.

en: Who do you think you're dealing with?
en-GB: Who do you think you're dealing with?

en: That tough act may impress the girls back home…
en-GB: That tough act may impress the girls back home…

en: …but I've seen scarier things in the mirror.
en-GB: …but I've seen scarier things in the mirror.

en: You can never trust a necromancer. We should just kill them all.
en-GB: You can never trust a necromancer. We should just kill them all.

en: We need to consult your master about an ancient magical artifact.
en-GB: We need to consult your master about an ancient magical artefact.

en: All we need is to talk to him, and then we'll be on our way and you'll never see us again.
en-GB: All we need is to talk to him, and then we'll be on our way and you'll never see us again.

en: I can't get you in to see the master, but I can help.
en-GB: I can't get you in to see the master, but I can help.

en: There are some things you should know.
en-GB: There are some things you should know.

en: You must think I'm a complete idiot.
en-GB: You must think I'm a complete idiot.

en: Look, whatever you do in the privacy of your own castle is your own business…
en-GB: Look, whatever you do in the privacy of your own castle is your own business…

en: …as long as you don't do it to us, of course.
en-GB: …as long as you don't do it to us, of course.

en: But the thing is, we've come a very long way…
en-GB: But the thing is, we've come a very long way…

en: …and it's vitally important that we speak to Master Mardracht.
en-GB: …and it's vitally important that we speak to Master Mardracht.

en: Oh, yes - it's a matter of life and - well, you know what I mean.
en-GB: Oh, yes - it's a matter of life and - well, you know what I mean.

en: Ah - I'm sorry. Really. But our orders are to speak only to him.
en-GB: Ah - I'm sorry. Really. But our orders are to speak only to him.

en: They come from the very highest level.
en-GB: They come from the very highest level.

en: I can't get you in to see the master, but I can help.
en-GB: I can't get you in to see the master, but I can help.

en: There are some things you should know.
en-GB: There are some things you should know.

en: Well, in that case, go straight upstairs and ask for Aksha.
en-GB: Well, in that case, go straight upstairs and ask for Aksha.

en: If anyone can persuade the master, she can.
en-GB: If anyone can persuade the master, she can.

en: If you want to talk to Mardracht, you'll have to get past Aksha.
en-GB: If you want to talk to Mardracht, you'll have to get past Aksha.

en: She turned up a few years ago, seemed interested in the work, offered to help out…
en-GB: She turned up a few years ago, seemed interested in the work, offered to help out…

en: …and suddenly she'd installed herself upstairs and no one talked to the master except through her.
en-GB: …and suddenly she'd installed herself upstairs and no one talked to the master except through her.

en: I haven't seen Mardracht face to face since she got here.
en-GB: I haven't seen Mardracht face to face since she got here.

en: She says she takes messages to him, and she brings messages back…
en-GB: She says she takes messages to him, and she brings messages back…

en: He was my mentor, my teacher.
en-GB: He was my mentor, my teacher.

en: She's holding him prisoner, I'm certain.
en-GB: She's holding him prisoner, I'm certain.

en: So we'll have to go through her?
en-GB: So we'll have to go through her?

en: If you can. She's got a pack of ghouls…
en-GB: If you can. She's got a pack of ghouls…

en: …and those defiler powers of hers are no joke, either.
en-GB: …and those defiler powers of hers are no joke, either.

en: We've tried using force before, more than once…
en-GB: We've tried using force before, more than once…

en: …but I got sick of losing people.
en-GB: …but I got sick of losing people.

en: Now, suppose we do manage to reach Master Mardracht…
en-GB: Now, suppose we do manage to reach Master Mardracht…

en: …what's the best way to approach him?
en-GB: …what's the best way to approach him?

en: …and then Aksha - who knows what she's done to him?
en-GB: …and then Aksha - who knows what she's done to him?

en: The stairs will take you to her apartments. Good luck getting past her.
en-GB: The stairs will take you to her apartments. Good luck getting past her.

en: Well. Lizzaria's taste in minions seems to be improving.
en-GB: Well. Lizzaria's taste in minions seems to be improving.

en: You defeated her, then? I'm almost impressed.
en-GB: You defeated her, then? I'm almost impressed.

en: We just want to talk to Mardracht.
en-GB: We just want to talk to Mardracht.

en: We need to speak to your master.
en-GB: We need to speak to your master.

en: You can get out of our way or try to stop us.
en-GB: You can get out of our way or try to stop us.

en: Let's trade. If you help us, we can help you.
en-GB: Let's trade. If you help us, we can help you.

en: An audience with Master Mardracht, and safe passage out of the castle.
en-GB: An audience with Master Mardracht, and safe passage out of the castle.

en: We'll leave an impression on you, too - a deep and bloody one!
en-GB: We'll leave an impression on you, too - a deep and bloody one!

en: I'm in a generous mood today. Go ahead - but don't expect to get any sense out of the old coward.
en-GB: I'm in a generous mood today. Go ahead - but don't expect to get any sense out of the old coward.

en: What does that mean - getting sense out of him?
en-GB: What does that mean - getting sense out of him?

en: Trade? What do you have that I could possibly want?
en-GB: Trade? What do you have that I could possibly want?

en: …but get me in to see Mardracht and the others are all yours.
en-GB: …but get me in to see Mardracht and the others are all yours.

en: You'd sell the lives of your companions to see one crazy old wizard?
en-GB: You'd sell the lives of your companions to see one crazy old wizard?

en: You must think I was born yesterday…
en-GB: You must think I was born yesterday…

en: We believe your master knows about a powerful ancient artifact.
en-GB: We believe your master knows about a powerful ancient artefact.

en: Hm. Your puny minds couldn't comprehend what he once knew.
en-GB: Hm. Your puny minds couldn't comprehend what he once knew.

en: Now, it's a good day if he knows who I am.
en-GB: Now, it's a good day if he knows who I am.

en: He's sealed his apartments off with powerful magic.
en-GB: He's sealed his apartments off with powerful magic.

en: Keeps raving about gods coming to get him.
en-GB: Keeps raving about gods coming to get him.

en: The Minor Gate is the only way in.
en-GB: The Minor Gate is the only way in.

en: Who are you? How did you get in here?
en-GB: Who are you? How did you get in here?

en: You know my name! How do you know my name?
en-GB: You know my name! How do you know my name?

en: We represent the Legacy Council, Master - and we mean you no harm.
en-GB: We represent the Legacy Council, Master - and we mean you no harm.

en: No harm? No harm, they say - they always say that, always. They lie!
en-GB: No harm? No harm, they say - they always say that, always. They lie!

en: Get out! I can still defend myself, you know!
en-GB: Get out! I can still defend myself, you know!

en: Can't you see we're too strong?
en-GB: Can't you see we're too strong?

en: We don't want to kill you.
en-GB: We don't want to kill you.

en: We found you and we breached your defenses.
en-GB: We found you and we breached your defences.

en: Do you really want to test your power against ours?
en-GB: Do you really want to test your power against ours?

en: You are right to fear us, and those who sent us.
en-GB: You are right to fear us, and those who sent us.

en: We are powerful - but you don't have to die.
en-GB: We are powerful - but you don't have to die.

en: All we ask is that you hear what we have to say.
en-GB: All we ask is that you hear what we have to say.

en: After that, we'll leave you in peace if that's what you want.
en-GB: After that, we'll leave you in peace if that's what you want.

en: If you are not here to kill me - then what?
en-GB: If you are not here to kill me - then what?

en: I offer you the chance to buy your life.
en-GB: I offer you the chance to buy your life.

en: Will you take it? Will you give up your gem?
en-GB: Will you take it? Will you give up your gem?

en: Lies! All lies! I know your gods and their treachery!
en-GB: Lies! All lies! I know your gods and their treachery!

en: The gods have commanded us to kill you…
en-GB: The gods have commanded us to kill you…

en: …but we don't need to do that - if you'll help us.
en-GB: …but we don't need to do that - if you'll help us.

en: We must have the Gem of Necromancy.
en-GB: We must have the Gem of Necromancy.

en: But without your gem, we can't remake the Crown.
en-GB: But without your gem, we can't remake the Crown.

en: Without the Crown, we can't defeat the gods.
en-GB: Without the Crown, we can't defeat the gods.

en: I… The gods? I don't… the Crown?
en-GB: I… The gods? I don't… the Crown?

en: I see through your lies! Your evil gods want its power to destroy me!

en-GB: The traditional stone for the honoured dead!

en: As for the rest of you, you said you were sent by the Legacy Council.
en-GB: As for the rest of you, you said you were sent by the Legacy Council.

en: We see a lot of Council agents on their way to the Badlands, and they bring a lot of rumors.
en-GB: We see a lot of Council agents on their way to the Badlands, and they bring a lot of rumours.

en: So tell me - is there any truth to the rumor that the Soraks are back?
en-GB: So tell me - is there any truth to the rumour that the Soraks are back?

en: Yes! And they are as nasty as legends made them!
en-GB: Yes! And they are as nasty as legends made them!

en: …if you believe the tales that the paladins of Einar recovered from their archives.
en-GB: …if you believe the tales that the paladins of Einar recovered from their archives.

en: Do me a favor: walk around our city, talk to the people…
en-GB: Do me a favour: walk around our city, talk to the people…

en: …then report your impressions to Sergeant Nikannen.
en-GB: …then report your impressions to Sergeant Nikannen.

en: Not a word about what you told me, though.
en-GB: Not a word about what you told me, though.

en: Do you believe the Soraks are in Coparann?
en-GB: Do you believe the Soraks are in Coparann?

en: I'll say no more for the time being!
en-GB: I'll say no more for the time being!

en: Walk the streets, then see Nikannen! Meanwhile, stay in the light!
en-GB: Walk the streets, then see Nikannen! Meanwhile, stay in the light!

en: It's rather silly, really. This young man…
en-GB: It's rather silly, really. This young man…

en: …he asked me for a specific design so he could propose…
en-GB: …he asked me for a specific design so he could propose…

en: So? He probably gambled the money away!
en-GB: So? He probably gambled the money away!

en: Not him! Straight arrow on the fast track to sergeant or higher! I asked around!
en-GB: Not him! Straight arrow on the fast track to sergeant or higher! I asked around!

en: So? Where is this paragon of yours?
en-GB: So? Where is this paragon of yours?

en: Consigned to guard duty! A whole week! And that just on his return from patrol!
en-GB: Consigned to guard duty! A whole week! And that just on his return from patrol!

en: Sergeant, when can I see my Erik? He is due some liberty!
en-GB: Sergeant, when can I see my Erik? He is due some liberty!

en: Gal, I already told ya! He's assigned to guard duty!
en-GB: Gal, I already told ya! He's assigned to guard duty!

en: A whole week of it - and that after two weeks on patrol!
en-GB: A whole week of it - and that after two weeks on patrol!

en: No - he just doesn't want to see me anymore.
en-GB: No - he just doesn't want to see me anymore.

en: Now, gal, don't you fret! It's not that at all.
en-GB: Now, gal, don't you fret! It's not that at all.

en: The Old Man has had his whole patrol on guard duty in the basement ever since they came back!
en-GB: The Old Man has had his whole patrol on guard duty in the basement ever since they came back!

en: Something's up - and whatever it is, it can't be good!
en-GB: Something's up - and whatever it is, it can't be good!

en: Mistress Mildred! The brewer wants to know when to bring the next delivery of ale.
en-GB: Mistress Mildred! The brewer wants to know when to bring the next delivery of ale.

en: He doesn't want it to go stale - he has his reputation to consider!
en-GB: He doesn't want it to go stale - he has his reputation to consider!

en: If only Stonefist had let his thirsty patrol out on leave as usual…
en-GB: If only Stonefist had let his thirsty patrol out on leave as usual…

en: …but now, we've only the regulars and the ale's not moving too fast!
en-GB: …but now, we've only the regulars and the ale's not moving too fast!

en: Take him two empty barrels and get two new ones. It's the best we can do right now!
en-GB: Take him two empty barrels and get two new ones. It's the best we can do right now!

en: A whole week he's been waiting - and still no meeting with the Baron!
en-GB: A whole week he's been waiting - and still no meeting with the Baron!

en: That's weird. Usually they meet every day, at least!
en-GB: That's weird. Usually they meet every day, at least!

en: Like an old couple, the two of them!
en-GB: Like an old couple, the two of them!

en: Well met! What can we do for you on this fine morning?
en-GB: Well met! What can we do for you on this fine morning?

en: We have a letter for you.
en-GB: We have a letter for you.

en: Clear skies to you! Master Goldentongue sent this letter!
en-GB: Clear skies to you! Master Goldentongue sent this letter!

en: Yes - Master Goldentongue's instructions are quite clear!
en-GB: Yes - Master Goldentongue's instructions are quite clear!

en: Here is your money - and here's a receipt to sign!
en-GB: Here is your money - and here's a receipt to sign!

en: Would you be interested in sampling our wares?
en-GB: Would you be interested in sampling our wares?

en: A pleasure doing business with you! Stay in the light!
en-GB: A pleasure doing business with you! Stay in the light!

en: The Ceannard sent us to talk to you.
en-GB: The Ceannard sent us to talk to you.

en: The Baron came back with a bunch of prisoners. Highwaymen, apparently.
en-GB: The Baron came back with a bunch of prisoners. Highwaymen, apparently.

en: I'm wondering why they didn't hang them on the spot!
en-GB: I'm wondering why they didn't hang them on the spot!

en: Hanging, eh? Would that be the normal practice?
en-GB: Hanging, eh? Would that be the normal practice?

en: Yes. You don't need that many prisoners to make them talk, if you ask me!
en-GB: Yes. You don't need that many prisoners to make them talk, if you ask me!

en: So - you've had a chance to walk around the city and hear what people are saying?
en-GB: So - you've had a chance to walk around the city and hear what people are saying?

en: Something is wrong. Soldiers back from a patrol denied leave…
en-GB: Something is wrong. Soldiers back from a patrol denied leave…

en: …posted to guard duty instead of visiting the tavern.
en-GB: …posted to guard duty instead of visiting the tavern.

en: The story with the highwaymen is also weird. Why keep them prisoner?
en-GB: The story with the highwaymen is also weird. Why keep them prisoner?

en: Normally the penalty is clear and swift.
en-GB: Normally the penalty is clear and swift.

en: On the frontier, you don't feed idle people, particularly not scum like highwaymen.
en-GB: On the frontier, you don't feed idle people, particularly not scum like highwaymen.

en: At best, you put them to work. At worst, they become fertilizer!
en-GB: At best, you put them to work. At worst, they become fertiliser!

en: There are two things I didn't mention in our last conversation.
en-GB: There are two things I didn't mention in our last conversation.

en: Things about Roald and the Baron.
en-GB: Things about Roald and the Baron.

en: When you told me of Roald's death and returned his personal effects…
en-GB: When you told me of Roald's death and returned his personal effects…

en: …I was speechless, not out of grief but…
en-GB: …I was speechless, not out of grief but…

en: …because, not a week before, Roald had come back from patrol!
en-GB: …because, not a week before, Roald had come back from patrol!

en: You mean… one of them is… not who he seems.
en-GB: You mean… one of them is… not who he seems.

en: I have known him for twenty years. I was a founding member of the company.
en-GB: I have known him for twenty years. I was a founding member of the company.

en: Now, for the first time in ten years, I am officer of the day, posted here.
en-GB: Now, for the first time in ten years, I am officer of the day, posted here.

en: For the last ten years he's always called me Joris. Now, all of a sudden it's back to Nikannen.
en-GB: For the last ten years he's always called me Joris. Now, all of a sudden it's back to Nikannen.

en: Something is wrong. I can feel it.
en-GB: Something is wrong. I can feel it.

en: The Ceannard mentioned your mission. He and I go way back.
en-GB: The Ceannard mentioned your mission. He and I go way back.

en: So - go see the baron and tell him your heirloom story.
en-GB: So - go see the baron and tell him your heirloom story.

en: I know what his normal reaction would be…
en-GB: I know what his normal reaction would be…

en: …so come back and we can compare notes.
en-GB: …so come back and we can compare notes.

en: And if I were you, I wouldn't mention Roald, the caravan, or anything else…
en-GB: And if I were you, I wouldn't mention Roald, the caravan, or anything else…

en: As the philosopher said, we must hang together or we'll hang separately!
en-GB: As the philosopher said, we must hang together or we'll hang separately!

en: Sergeant Nikannen says you want to see me on some urgent matter?
en-GB: Sergeant Nikannen says you want to see me on some urgent matter?

en: Yes. It concerns our traveling companion, Lady Kythaela.
en-GB: Yes. It concerns our travelling companion, Lady Kythaela.

en: Then let her speak for herself!
en-GB: Then let her speak for herself!

en: My lord, before the Cataclysm this valley was in the care of my family.
en-GB: My lord, before the Cataclysm this valley was in the care of my family.

en: Alas, only a few of us managed to survive - and none at all in the valley.
en-GB: Alas, only a few of us managed to survive - and none at all in the valley.

en: A sad tale, my lady, but not uncommon. Those were dire times.
en-GB: A sad tale, my lady, but not uncommon. Those were dire times.

en: My father passed away recently. Upon his death bed…
en-GB: My father passed away recently. Upon his death bed…

en: …he mentioned some family heirlooms left in a hidden room somewhere in the fortress.
en-GB: …he mentioned some family heirlooms left in a hidden room somewhere in the fortress.

en: …I would like to search for this hidden room and retrieve my family's belongings.
en-GB: …I would like to search for this hidden room and retrieve my family's belongings.

en: Out of the question! This is my castle and all in it belongs to me!
en-GB: Out of the question! This is my castle and all in it belongs to me!

en: Now begone - and be glad that, as a guest, you are protected by our customs…
en-GB: Now begone - and be glad that, as a guest, you are protected by our customs…

en: …otherwise, your impudence would land you in the dungeon!
en-GB: …otherwise, your impudence would land you in the dungeon!

en: Ah - you're back! How did the audience go?
en-GB: Ah - you're back! How did the audience go?

en: Clear skies! Well, he didn't imprison us, just threw us out!
en-GB: Clear skies! Well, he didn't imprison us, just threw us out!

en: Just threw you out? That's not like him at all!
en-GB: Just threw you out? That's not like him at all!

en: Oh? He's not always so generous to strangers?
en-GB: Oh? He's not always so generous to strangers?

en: It would be cheaper to let you find the heirlooms, under close escort.
en-GB: It would be cheaper to let you find the heirlooms, under close escort.

en: He'd demand a fee, but it's easier than having to search for himself!
en-GB: He'd demand a fee, but it's easier than having to search for himself!

en: Of course, smart! If we assume Lady Kythaela's story is true…
en-GB: Of course, smart! If we assume Lady Kythaela's story is true…

en: …then arresting her or coercing her could have drawn the ire of an elven clan.
en-GB: …then arresting her or coercing her could have drawn the ire of an elven clan.

en: A pretty stupid move for stuff which might only have sentimental value!
en-GB: A pretty stupid move for stuff which might only have sentimental value!

en: So, not like Gromnir at all!
en-GB: So, not like Gromnir at all!

en: Let me make some preparations. You go back to him tomorrow…
en-GB: Let me make some preparations. You go back to him tomorrow…

en: Sergeant Nikannen, why are you bringing these people to me again?
en-GB: Sergeant Nikannen, why are you bringing these people to me again?

en: My lord, they showed me credentials that I thought you should see.
en-GB: My lord, they showed me credentials that I thought you should see.

en: Credentials? What do credentials have to do with Lady Kythaela's claims?
en-GB: Credentials? What do credentials have to do with Lady Kythaela's claims?

en: My lord, we are deputies of the Legacy Council!
en-GB: My lord, we are deputies of the Legacy Council!

en: And the Legacy Council interferes in Coparann's affairs?
en-GB: And the Legacy Council interferes in Coparann's affairs?

en: Why didn't you say so yesterday?
en-GB: Why didn't you say so yesterday?

en: We do not flaunt our allegiance unless there is need, my lord!
en-GB: We do not flaunt our allegiance unless there is need, my lord!

en: Lady Kythaela works for the Legacy Council.
en-GB: Lady Kythaela works for the Legacy Council.

en: Lady Kythaela has agreed to help the Council…
en-GB: Lady Kythaela has agreed to help the Council…

en: Those… baubles have some historical value?
en-GB: Those… baubles have some historical value?

en: We believe so, my lord. We wouldn't be here otherwise.
en-GB: We believe so, my lord. We wouldn't be here otherwise.

en: Then why not just say so?
en-GB: Then why not just say so?

en: Confidential matters are best handled confidentially, my lord.
en-GB: Confidential matters are best handled confidentially, my lord.

en: Then - ah, shall we search for these heirlooms together?
en-GB: Then - ah, shall we search for these heirlooms together?

en: I shall escort you and we'll inventory the… historical items.
en-GB: I shall escort you and we'll inventory the… historical items.

en: Then we can discuss a reasonable share for the keep.
en-GB: Then we can discuss a reasonable share for the keep.

en: That would be more than fair, my lord!
en-GB: That would be more than fair, my lord!

en: Then please lead the way! Where should we start?
en-GB: Then please lead the way! Where should we start?

en: Let's go, then! Nikannen, you were right to bring them to me!
en-GB: Let's go, then! Nikannen, you were right to bring them to me!

en: Go. I'll meet you in the basement.
en-GB: Go. I'll meet you in the basement.

en: And so near the dungeons. How subtle - and fitting.
en-GB: And so near the dungeons. How subtle - and fitting.

en: Please, Lady Kythaela, before we inventory your heirlooms…
en-GB: Please, Lady Kythaela, before we inventory your heirlooms…

en: …there is something I wish to show you.
en-GB: …there is something I wish to show you.

en: You will find it interesting, hopefully.
en-GB: You will find it interesting, hopefully.

en: So nice of you to drop by.
en-GB: So nice of you to drop by.

en: Now we shall all have a nice, long chat together!
en-GB: Now we shall all have a nice, long chat together!

en: And you will tell us everything!
en-GB: And you will tell us everything!

en: Ah - and guards… Gromnir has outlived his usefulness!
en-GB: Ah - and guards… Gromnir has outlived his usefulness!

en: And you will give me that Crown!
en-GB: And you will give me that Crown!

en: Lady Kythaela, dear friends - words aren't enough to convey my thanks!
en-GB: Lady Kythaela, dear friends - words aren't enough to convey my thanks!

en: Your swift action has saved my life - and our vale!
en-GB: Your swift action has saved my life - and our vale!

en: We shall be more wary of the Council's warnings…
en-GB: We shall be more wary of the Council's warnings…

en: This changes our position towards the Council.
en-GB: This changes our position towards the Council.

en: Indeed. I thought they exaggerated, alas!
en-GB: Indeed. I thought they exaggerated, alas!

en: If anything, they weren't loud enough!
en-GB: If anything, they weren't loud enough!

en: You are right to do so, but in such matters, only conviction and proof are effective!
en-GB: You are right to do so, but in such matters, only conviction and proof are effective!

en: Soraks are real - you saw them with your own eyes.
en-GB: Soraks are real - you saw them with your own eyes.

en: Their presence was a clear message: be wary! Be careful!
en-GB: Their presence was a clear message: be wary! Be careful!

en: True! We won't let our guard down!
en-GB: True! We won't let our guard down!

en: How does this change your position?
en-GB: How does this change your position?

en: Coparann must stand with the Council!
en-GB: Coparann must stand with the Council!

en: Do you plan to join the Council?
en-GB: Do you plan to join the Council?

en: Or simply to help us in our endeavors?
en-GB: Or simply to help us in our endeavours?

en: We shall join! The discovery of the hidden Gate…
en-GB: We shall join! The discovery of the hidden Gate…

en: But enough about matters of state!
en-GB: But enough about matters of state!

en: The Ceannard has the right of it!
en-GB: The Ceannard has the right of it!

en: The only benefit of power is the ability to reward friends!
en-GB: The only benefit of power is the ability to reward friends!

en: And true friends of Coparann you have proven to be!
en-GB: And true friends of Coparann you have proven to be!

en: Thanks for your kind words! We feel quite rewarded.
en-GB: Thanks for your kind words! We feel quite rewarded.

en: Hush, you! Ceannard, Lord Stonefist - many thanks for your kind words!
en-GB: Hush, you! Ceannard, Lord Stonefist - many thanks for your kind words!

en: And praise be your resilience, so we could rescue you alive!
en-GB: And praise be your resilience, so we could rescue you alive!

en: That resilience would have amounted to nothing…
en-GB: That resilience would have amounted to nothing…

en: You are hereby granted permanent citizenship of Coparann, with all associated rights!
en-GB: You are hereby granted permanent citizenship of Coparann, with all associated rights!

en: As well as free use of our rediscovered Gate!
en-GB: As well as free use of our rediscovered Gate!

en: The keys to the town, maybe?
en-GB: The keys to the town, maybe?

en: And these gems from our mines are well suited to holding enchantments.
en-GB: And these gems from our mines are well suited to holding enchantments.

en: Go forth on your journey with our blessings!
en-GB: Go forth on your journey with our blessings!

en: Many thanks for your generous gifts! May Einar watch over Coparann!
en-GB: Many thanks for your generous gifts! May Einar watch over Coparann!

en: And it's had recent visitors. Look here in the mud - a boot print.
en-GB: And it's had recent visitors. Look here in the mud - a boot print.

en: And the rain has only just stopped! Let's be careful!
en-GB: And the rain has only just stopped! Let's be careful!

en: Lady Kythaela! Do you know how to enter the Tower?
en-GB: Lady Kythaela! Do you know how to enter the Tower?

en: And you will make a nice main dish!
en-GB: And you will make a nice main dish!

en: Master, here I am, at last!
en-GB: Master, here I am, at last!

en: Kythaela could use some healing, I think!
en-GB: Kythaela could use some healing, I think!

en: Yes, dazzle us! Allow me to thank you for your actions!
en-GB: Yes, dazzle us! Allow me to thank you for your actions!

en: I have tried for years to open that door! And here you are!
en-GB: I have tried for years to open that door! And here you are!

en: An answer to my prayers! It would almost lead me to believe…
en-GB: An answer to my prayers! It would almost lead me to believe…

en: …in the benevolence of the gods! Albeit my very existence proves otherwise!
en-GB: …in the benevolence of the gods! Albeit my very existence proves otherwise!

en: You have my thanks, whoever you are.
en-GB: You have my thanks, whoever you are.

en: You're welcome, I guess. But your thanks for what exactly?
en-GB: You're welcome, I guess. But your thanks for what exactly?

en: For dealing with this… foulness when I was incapacitated.
en-GB: For dealing with this… foulness when I was incapacitated.

en: This evil was new to me, not something Manacalon ever knew.
en-GB: This evil was new to me, not something Manacalon ever knew.

en: Yes, Kythaela was - or even is - a part of me!
en-GB: Yes, Kythaela was - or even is - a part of me!

en: No, It is also me speaking, my friend, and your care is much appreciated!
en-GB: No, It is also me speaking, my friend, and your care is much appreciated!

en: I don't understand what happened here!
en-GB: I don't understand what happened here!

en: Kythaela was a last-ditch contingency - one I didn't truly think I would ever need!
en-GB: Kythaela was a last-ditch contingency - one I didn't truly think I would ever need!

en: A vessel for my knowledge and memories!
en-GB: A vessel for my knowledge and memories!

en: But how did she awaken, a thousand years after the Cataclysm?
en-GB: But how did she awaken, a thousand years after the Cataclysm?

en: The revival process was tied to an ambient level of mana.
en-GB: The revival process was tied to an ambient level of mana.

en: One of the secrets of the Arcaneum, yes!
en-GB: One of the secrets of the Arcaneum, yes!

en: Yes, the merging process takes time - time during which I was almost helpless!
en-GB: Yes, the merging process takes time - time during which I was almost helpless!

en: Never met such a creature before?
en-GB: Never met such a creature before?

en: No. Manacalon, for all its faults, revered life!
en-GB: No. Manacalon, for all its faults, revered life!

en: This was a negation of life, an abomination!
en-GB: This was a negation of life, an abomination!

en: Manacalon? Are you one of the… ?
en-GB: Manacalon? Are you one of the… ?

en: Adrasteia the Prudent Shield, Master of Abjuration. In your debt, and at your service!
en-GB: Adrasteia the Prudent Shield, Master of Abjuration. In your debt, and at your service!

en: You were at the battle of the Rift?
en-GB: You were at the battle of the Rift?

en: Yes, and there I must apologize for Kythaela's misconceptions.
en-GB: Yes, and there I must apologise for Kythaela's misconceptions.

en: Yes. She was created with an elven personality, and carried certain… prejudices.
en-GB: Yes. She was created with an elven personality, and carried certain… prejudices.

en: The Empire wasn't kind to… other races.
en-GB: The Empire wasn't kind to… other races.

en: The humans surprised you, it seems.
en-GB: The humans surprised you, it seems.

en: They all came together to save Solasta!
en-GB: They all came together to save Solasta!

en: The Golden Cavalry charging and breaking the lines of the Sorr-Akkath!
en-GB: The Golden Cavalry charging and breaking the lines of the Sorr-Akkath!

en: The Iron Legions and the Shield Wall of the dwarves…
en-GB: The Iron Legions and the Shield Wall of the dwarves…

en: …holding the enemy at bay, flank to flank!
en-GB: …holding the enemy at bay, flank to flank!

en: Our shock arcanists and the human paladins together…
en-GB: Our shock arcanists and the human paladins together…

en: …giving their lives to give us a chance to close the Rift!
en-GB: …giving their lives to give us a chance to close the Rift!

en: And, as another wave came through…
en-GB: And, as another wave came through…

en: Kaseinax had us walking Solasta in elven form for so long…
en-GB: Kaseinax had us walking Solasta in elven form for so long…

en: …but at this moment we resumed our true forms!
en-GB: …but at this moment we resumed our true forms!

en: To secure the Rift for a few crucial moments…
en-GB: To secure the Rift for a few crucial moments…

en: …buying time with our lives in a furnace of magic and steel!
en-GB: …buying time with our lives in a furnace of magic and steel!

en: Take it, old friend, once again.
en-GB: Take it, old friend, once again.

en: I feel your spirit in the Crown, Kaseinax!
en-GB: I feel your spirit in the Crown, Kaseinax!

en: The Magister is still in the Crown?
en-GB: The Magister is still in the Crown?

en: Please accept these few tokens of my gratitude!
en-GB: Please accept these few tokens of my gratitude!

en: I must rest now. I foresee one last flight, when the need is greatest…
en-GB: I must rest now. I foresee one last flight, when the need is greatest…

en: …and for that, I will need all my strength.
en-GB: …and for that, I will need all my strength.

en: Use my Gate freely. I believe you know how.
en-GB: Use my Gate freely. I believe you know how.

en: We shall meet again, before the end!
en-GB: We shall meet again, before the end!

en: But before you take your leave, if you would be so kind…
en-GB: But before you take your leave, if you would be so kind…

en: This creature you forced to flee still plagues my grounds with his minions.
en-GB: This creature you forced to flee still plagues my grounds with his minions.

en: Would you deal with them and free their prisoners?
en-GB: Would you deal with them and free their prisoners?

en: We owe you that much. Thank you, Master Adrasteia.
en-GB: We owe you that much. Thank you, Master Adrasteia.

en: My name is Atima Bladeburn, priestess of Arun.
en-GB: My name is Atima Bladeburn, priestess of Arun.

en: What can I do for you?
en-GB: What can I do for you?

en: Just passing by to pay our respects.
en-GB: Just passing by to pay our respects.

en: Then good luck and fair weather, friends.
en-GB: Then good luck and fair weather, friends.

en: Yes, I am - thanks to Joris and these adventurers, it seems!
en-GB: Yes, I am - thanks to Joris and these adventurers, it seems!

en: Now, old friend - go see Atima with Joris!
en-GB: Now, old friend - go see Atima with Joris!

en: I am the Ceannard, and you…
en-GB: I am the Ceannard, and you…

en: …you shall resume your duties only if our cleric says you're fit enough.
en-GB: …you shall resume your duties only if our cleric says you're fit enough.

en: No buts! I shall secure the Keep and the valley till you're back!
en-GB: No buts! I shall secure the Keep and the valley till you're back!

en: As for you, my friends, find Lady Kythaela's belongings…
en-GB: As for you, my friends, find Lady Kythaela's belongings…

en: …and meet me in the throne room.
en-GB: …and meet me in the throne room.

en: Tell us, Lady Kythaela, what did you find? A gem?
en-GB: Tell us, Lady Kythaela, what did you find? A gem?

en: This is my spellbook - I remember!
en-GB: This is my spellbook - I remember!

en: A wand, a robe, some money, and a piece of paper.
en-GB: A wand, a robe, some money, and a piece of paper.

en: I… don't know. There is only one word written on the paper: "Adrasteo"
